user_review: First time in Montreal, and everyone I spoke to mentioned this place as a must go to. Usually, it seems like this place is packed in regular times. With the pandemic, there's still a wait, but it's not as busy and well worth visiting.Litterally the best sandwich/panini I've ever had. I had Le Cubain, but I'd like to go back to try the Egg on your face as expectations are high!

Honestly I always heard about this place and I live a short walk away but never got around to trying it. Last weekend I finally did so and it is as delicious as it gets. I had the cubano sandwhich which seems to be the one most recommended by people who have tried it, and I can honestly say best sandwhich I've ever had. Everything is made inhouse, and you can taste the difference in that fresh bread  they also have a pretty nice collection of wine for take out

I always wanted to come here but it took so long to do it. I always thought the menu was pricey. I came there during tea time, somehow, the place looked a bit dark from inside.I ordered The Vegan Plate. The plate looks beautiful and delicious. I liked everything on the plate and the beet hummus was my favorite. The cashew dip was flavorful with seasoning and spicy oil and I loved the fresh cucumbers to temper the spiciness. I took the Killer Cookie to go. I love their chocolate chip cookie. It has lots of chocolate! It's a large cookie so I eat half of it and save the rest for the next day.Next time, I would like to try the Cha-Cha-chia bowl.
Everything at Olive & Gourmando is delicious.  The coffee, danishes, the creative salads and sandwiches. Love.

The best breakfast panini and quick service! On a Wednesday at noon, there was no line up  but still a busy inside. We walked through the sludge because we heard great things and we were so glad we checked it out! I would opt for a latte instead of the drip coffee ( it was too dark for my liking). The poached egg panini was spicy and flavourful I'd recommend  it! We also oordered the chocolate brioche... I think I'd ask them to warm it up next time. The Waiter seated us promptly and got our food quickly.

It took a blinding snowstorm and some pretty cold weather to beat the crowds back from this place so I could finally try it without waiting in line. I had the Cuban sandwich and a bowl of Black Bean and Bacon soup, total tab was $44 including a glass of wine, tax and tip. The sandwich was ridiculously good (actually everything was ridiculously good). The outside of the bread was so crispy and tasty! Very high quality prep for a soup and sandwich experience. The service was also great, friendly and efficient. I won't wait for another act of nature to go back!

THE CHOCOLATE BANANA BRIOCHE IS LIFE- CHANGING!A definite must order if visiting this cafe. Additionally we ordered yogurt parfaits which were very satisfying, although a bit overprice. Because we came before 11am, the lunch menu was not available. The breakfast selection was a bit sparse, and basically consisted of pastries. If I ever visit Montreal again I would go back to try their legendary paninis!

The egg on your face panini is incredible. Perfect amount of toasting, gooey cheese, salty speck, and fatty egg (not oozing poached egg though - so it wasn't as drippy as I envisioned but tasty nonetheless). Waited about 10 mins when I arrived around 12:10. Was super lucky too - during those ten minutes, about 8 or so other groups came in until the waiting area couldn't hold any more people.

The wait time was worth it. They said it would be an hour and a half wait but it turned out being more like 45mins for two.      We had the Mr. Miami panini and the poached egg on your face panini. -Mr.Miami panini; a smoked beef brisket, grilled red onions, cilantro pesto mayo, and jalapeño havarti cheese served with pineapple jalapeño chutney, on a freshly baked bread made at location.-Poached egg on your face panini; spicy poached eggs sriracha and herbs, raw milk cheese, speck (pork) and roasted tomatoes, on a freshly baked and pressed bread made at location.      Both were, with our at home culinary skills, impossible to duplicate without coming to Olive & Gourmando. We however skilled at cooking (Specially the wife) are not confident it would come out as amazing as it did here.      It was overall the perfect balance of crisp on the bread, juicy flavor of meats and special sauces and the temp was spot on. However big the panini's were they never over dripped or lost their form while eating. It was just very pleasant. Add to this their espresso and we were in heaven.

We arrived at prime brunch time but was able to sit at the community table. This place is so cute! The place is super cozy and the food looked amazing. One thing about the menu though there is not that many options for breakfast which is fine we both found something we wanted.I ordered mocha and we Both ordered the spicy egg Panini sandwich. Food and drink came out pretty quickly.    The mocha was delicious creamy and chocolatey. The sandwich was huge and contained a lot of spice from the  Siarachi sauce. The cheese, veggies and pork in the sandwich was absolutely delicious! The sandwich was perfect and I are every bite of it :) it was a great start to our day having breakfast here !

Great spot for breakfast or lunch! We visited Olive & Gourmando during our visit to Montreal. It had many many awesome reviews, so we had to try! It definitely did not disappoint!! We ordered Cuban panini and green salad with local beer. The panini was so perfect and the salad was very simple yet very tasty. I think the dressing and almond made the difference. Also the cold local beer was like a taste of heaven since the weather was pretty hot when we visited end of July! We used Yelp waitlist system, and we did not have to wait when we got to the restaurant! It worked out perfectly. So please use their yelp waitlist system, so that you don't have to wait in line for a long time. Would love to visit again if we are in the area. Their bakery looked good, too!

PERFECT SPOT FOR A SCONE, CROISSANT AND COFFEE================================================DETAILS:My husband, son and I had breakfast at this restaurant a few times while we were staying in Montreal earlier this month.  I had it bookmarked because of the amazing reviews and it was so good we kept going back.FOOD: 5/5 STARSWhat can be better than freshly baked croissants and blueberry scones?  That is hard to beat with a great latte to go with it or tea for my husband.  He's pretty picky with his tea and he loved theirs.  My son was a happy camper.SERVICE:  5/5 STARSIt's great.  Food and coffee served up quickly and someone is always around if you need something else.AMBIANCE:  5/5 STARSI love the beautiful open windows with all the plants.  It is perfect to enjoy a nice relaxing breakfast.PARKING:  3/5 STARSWe walked from the Westin, but it looks like parking is possible on the street.  If not there are structures near the big hotels.

One of the best panini in Montreal!Olive & Gourmando is a small hipster restaurant located in the old port of Montreal. Although a bit cramp, there does not have loud background music, and it's easy to converse. The menu is simple and easy to understand, and the panini never fails to impress. Each component of the sandwich is individually delicious, blanketed with cheese and sauce, with a perfectly toasted panini bread.I recommend this restaurant to everyone who passes the old port.

Olive et Gourmando is a very popular cafe in the heart of Old Montreal. It's always busy, but my family of three didn't have to wait long around 8:30am on a Tuesday.The food is pretty good. I ordered a spicy breakfast panini and it was great! My latte also was delicious. The one thing that wasn't great was the almond croissant. It comes out skinny and not as good compared to other spots in the city.The service was the other complaint. They were focused on getting people in and out and failed to be friendly.

This place was disappointing. It's always a crappy visit when you wait for a long time to get seated and after that, the server tells you that all of the food ran out and you are limited with what you can order. I got there early on a Thursday and it was still packed. Guess that is how it is for the summer. Before getting there, I did put myself on the Yelp waitlist just so my queue wasn't too bad once I got there.Anyways, I was seated around 9:45 and service was pretty slow. I didn't know who my server was until it was almost 10 am. The server was really nice so I definitely appreciated that. Then my feelings of disappointment started to kick in. So ideally, I wanted to try the poached egg on your face panini. Out. Then I was like okay let's do a backup sandwich then, The Cuban panini please. No can do because lunch is not served yet. So it's 10 am... do I wait an hour until lunch starts or do I order other things?So yes, I decided to just stay and order different items. I ordered the homemade sweet ricotta, dirty chai cold, and the Valrhona chocolate brioche. (P.S. I love Valrhona chocolate, I've baked with it so many times before. My ideal chocolate actually)The ricotta was alright. The dirty chai came out hot... I t's a hot summer day and they thought I said "chaude" which means hot in French when I actually said cold. (Which I don't get because I literally ordered everything in English... but anyways I didn't want to waste it so I kept the hot drink). Lastly, the brioche was dry so I had to dip it in the dirty chai to soften it up. Honestly, this place is way too hyped. Timing is everything here and honestly, I visited at the worst time possible. It's not the restaurants fault, service was great. Food ran out... (quickly!), but since I was visiting from out of town and this being my one and only visit, I just wished  things turned out for the better. Beautiful aesthetic though for the decor of the restaurant.To all the future visitors, please get your timings right. Either visit when it truly opens for breakfast or make sure to make it for lunch. Don't land in the limbo time frame and make the same mistakes I did.

Bonjour. Keeping it real out here.Place is pretty bomb and definitely deserves the hype. We got panini sandwiches and they are the most greasy crunchy good tasting paninis ever. Would def go back if I visit Montréal again

The place was very very busy and very noisy when we arrived, so I think it's better to come earlier to get a table! Unfortunately, the bakery section was almost gone, but I was able to get the small or "petite" Latte which is $4,75 and very very small, I would say pay ¢25 to get a 2x larger one. I have taken  the almond croissant which was great though, pricing for $5. I think that this place is decent because of its bakery products, Italian cuisine and ambiance.

Small and pretty crowded with a lively atmosphere, Olive & Gourmando seems to be The place to get lunch in Montreal. The menu is pretty small but I was happy to see mac n cheese on it. It was quite good and came with a much-needed and proper side salad (not just leaves but also nuts and onions with good dressing). The Cuban panini could have had more meat and more flavor. We topped it all off with the chocolate chip cookie, which was overbaked, with most of it very crispy and only the very middle chewy. If you like a crispy cookie then it would be your jam!

I came here for breakfast after someone I know told me this place was good. It is seriously...hands down the most amazing food I have eaten on my trip!I came here approximately 0830am Thursday and came again on Saturday morning. They open at 0800am and the place was already pretty full. However, my party of 4 was seated right away. They do speak english which is a plus. It's a cute restaurant/cafe style and has pastries on display up front. Order:Poached egg on your face: It's a breakfast panini with spicy poached eggs, pork, cheese, siriacha, cheese and tomatoes. It doesn't sound that amazing, but first bite into the panini and it was heaven. The bread of the panini had a nice crunch to it with every bite, the mix of the eggs, cheese, tomatoes, pork and the spice to it was amazing. It has a pretty good kick of spice to it and I loved it. It is a must try!Home made sweet ricotta: It's ricotta with honey and orange zest on top with toast on the side. I love ricotta. So I had to try this dish! The sweetness of the honey and orange zest in the ricotta blends so well together. Spread it on the toast and it's awesome! Home made granola with fresh fruit and yogurt: Fresh fruits and granola topped onto yogurt. I only had a bite of this dish, but the one who ordered it really enjoyed it. The best part of it was the fruits were really fresh.Cheese Croissant and Almond Croissant: Ugh..best croissants I have ever had in my life. It was so flaky and buttery in each bite. Simple, yet so good. I wish I had the chance to try their lunch menu items. I heard it's just as amazing. I highly recommend this place if you either live in the area, or visit the city.

Oozing cheese and greasy fingerstastes so good you hope it lingers.Maybe a wait, bustling and loudbut cozy and friendly despite the crowd.Crunchy, buttery, almond bliss.This place is one you shouldn't miss.

It's been almost two weeks and I'm still thinking about that poached egg on your face panini I had at this place in Montreal. We were on an early flight and hopped on a bus from the airport and got off on a random stop in downtown. Looked up yelp to find a place to eat as we had several hours before we could check into our Airbnb. Thankfully this place was only a ten minute walk from where we were. I put us on the waitlist and we walked over and were seated immediately once we got there. There was a big line outside that we just walked past thanks to the yelp waitlist.My girlfriend got the chocolate croissant and the warm potato salad. I got the poached egg on your face panini and it was fantastic. One of the best sandwiches I've ever had. It was a flavor bomb with cheese, eggs and meat. The crust gave it the perfect texture to add to all the oozing middle.The service was quick and friendly. The restaurant is a little crowded and the tables and seats are all very close to each other. But overall great experience and I will definitely be back for that panini.

I was a little disappointed with this spot. It's quite a busy place during lunch hours and I heard amazing things about the sandwiches. When I finally got around to trying them they were actually incredibly oily to the point that it was very messy and hard to enjoy. If they go easy on the oil, I think the sandwiches could be quite delicious - the meats on their own were really really great. The salsa that comes with one of the paninis is also amazing.

We visited Olive et Gourmando on a Saturday morning and the wait was about 20-30 minutes. I signed in on the Yelp wait-list ahead of time which allowed us to walk in and be seated. No matter what, the food is worth the wait. We arrived on the cusp of lunch so we ordered both breakfast and lunch items. The coffee was perfect as was the cinnamon bun pastry. We also tried the yogurt granola bowl which was filled with fresh and dried fruits. It was lovely. Finally we had the Mr. Miami panini which is AMAZING. Highly recommended!

Okay, so I came late and there were no chocolate brioche so I'm disappointed. Had an almond croissant. This is dense compared to the traditional ones that are taking day-old croissants and adding almond paste to it. It wasn't most enough either even though it is dense.I had a chai latte. It was yum. The service was great. The place was decorated really festive like the other cafes in Old Montreal for Christmas. I'm not opposed to coming back and actually coming back for a meal. We went to the timeout foodhall as well and didn't find the brioche there either.

The food is good. Location is great. Cosy for a couple. Or very few friends. But everytime I went with the kids, the food was not to their liking=not for kids (in my opinion). Service is good. Clean. I never waited for more than ten minutes while there was a lineup. Take the metro going there as parking is hell and enjoy the walk around the old port.
A good place for lunch or snack and coffee. There is always a line up no matter weekday or weekend. The salads and sandwiches are tasty. Coffee and drinks are ok.

I can't really give this a super honest rating. I got there like at 10am and they sold out of what I was going there for which is the chocolate banana brioche. I got a chocolate croissant which was really good. Their mocha coffee and hit chocolate where really good but I've had better out here. They yogurt with granola and fruits was amazing. The vibes and service where amazing. Really chill and awesome spot to have breakfast items and coffee. A bit of a wait during busy days, so don't go with big groups. Get there early for the best bakery items.

It's always difficult to find a new favorite when it's located an entire country away. If I lived in Montreal, I could see myself tucking away here often.The interior has a rustic country kitchen vibe to it. It's smaller than it appears from the outside, and to maximize their occupancy the arrangement of seating is very intimate. There's several tables and a communal hightop - as a solo traveler, I was sat at the latter with a family having breakfast. It was *that* busy on a Wednesday midmorning when I came that it was the only spot available (if I were you, I'd try and snag the seats against the window! they're the most private and the best people watching!).The menu wasn't the draw for me here - the baked goods and pastries were. I ended up having a lovely cup of coffee and the chocolate banana brioche - which was hands down one of the best things I've eaten in a long time. Think flaky, melt-in-your-mouth, but dense cinnamon roll with creamy dark chocolate and mellow hints of banana. It wasn't as sweet as you might think. I have craved this divine little treat often since I first had it. Sigh. Someone want to ship me some?I will for sure be back when I'm in Montreal next, but I'd probably just get a box of pastries/baked goods to go! My advice? If you're eyeing something in particular here: just get it, it'll absolutely be worth it!

What is there to say about a place that already has a great reputation and great presence on yelp? Well it certaintly lived up to both it's hype as well as it's long wait! I got the sell known spicy egg breakfest panini and my boyfriend ordered the cuban panini and we shared a side of potatos with an almond croissant (the last one of the day apparently) to go! Everything was delicious and the waitstaff was wonderful. We also enjoyed the local fun and rustic cafe feel. I do think they would benefit from having more than one bathroom though if they do continue to be as crowded as they get.

This is a Montreal spot that is definitely worth the hype. Stopped in here on a Friday afternoon around 2:30pm while exploring Old City and had to wait about 20 minutes. We got the ricotta salty, soup, and a few other small items. Everything was incredible. Specifically the bread was so fresh and tasty. If you're in the area and have a chance to stop into this spot, definitely do it!

Since the wait was so long on Saturday morning when we got here, we only got grab and go food and drinks. It's a little chaotic when you get there at peak times like we did. Even the takeaway line has a long wait.I got the pear and hazelnut croissant which was delicious. The coffee was pretty good as well, although their milk selection is a bit limited. They have a lot of non-dairy milks but no skim or 1%. Despite the craziness the staff was friendly and patient. I'd like to come back and try a sit-down meal sometime.

Still as crowded and still as good-ish! I don't know if it's because I've been noticing fatty food more or it did get worse, but I find their sandwich oily. It still tastes good, but the oil makes you not want to finish the sandwich entirely.Also! I just noticed they let you put yourself on the waitlist through the Yelp app...it's so amazing! You get real-time update of how many tables before you, the wait time, etc. I find that pretty neat!

It's been a few years since my last visit to Olive & Gourmando so I decided to take C with me for brunch. They're still as popular as ever, perhaps even more so.We dropped in on a Sunday (around 11:00am) and had to wait 15 minutes for a table to open up. The inside is open air and has a lively, vibrant vibe to it.If you don't want to eat a meal here, grabbing a pastry or two is worth a quick pitstop. There's three separate menus for breakfast, brunch and lunch. Seems a little excessive with an overlap of some items.- The Mr. Miami ($14.95) - smoked beef brisket, grilled red onion, cilantro pesto mayo, havarti, pineapple and jalapeño salsa. The sandwich was okay but there was no wow factor. - Tartine ($18.00) - house ricotta, cucumber, roasted squash, Asian pear, nuts and a herbs & honey + lemon + Aleppo pear dressing. This was impressive. The combo of flavours worked wonders.O&G is still a classic spot in the Old Port.

My husband and I stopped in for brunch on a Friday morning and had a wonderful experience! I was on crutches and despite it being fairly packed, they were very accommodating.The food was delicious. The cinnamon role is a must-try (picture below), as is the poached egg on your face panini. We split each of those and it was the perfect amount of food for two people. Next time we are in Montreal we will be back!

This lives up to all the reviews. Thanks to yelpers, this has been an amazing breakfast adventure for my palate. The poached egg on your face is a burst of flavors-spicy,creamy,salty and totally sumptuous! The cha cha chia bowl of my gluten-sensitive hubby was light, fresh and so yummy. He and I were in food heaven. Coffee was great- I love mine dark roast and he had sencha green tea which he loved as well. Awesome way to start our city walking tour of old Montreal.
How can we not crave thei sandwiches?Really nice bread! Iconic sandwich place based in old mtl! Their vegetarian sandwich made me consider being vegan one day ;)

As a tourist to go to Montreal alone, I will not be able to handle the 3 hours dinner settings, so I picked this place based on yelp.  The food is great.  The service is friendly and nice.  The neighborhood is nice, despite the slushy winter mess.The catch is, since I am a tourist, I could have almost the same thing else where (as long as I am not in Montreal).I think this place has the friendly ambience, and great food and service, and the price was great, but don't expecting too much beyond that (no whoa factor).  I have equivalent/ better bakeries elsewhere.Go for the Mac and cheese (I will say share it, as if you finish the whole thing you will think it is too much), cheese crossiant, or regular crossiant.Thanks for the great Montreal experience.

Come here for the food and pastries, not the coffee! We came here on New Years Eve, when literally every other cafe/coffee shop was closed, so it was packed. The wait was 45 minutes for 3, so I decided to grab an americano and pastry to go. The chocolate brioche bun was incredible! Flaky and crisp on the outside, and filled with chocolate inside. The coffee was dreadful though. I was given the wrong order and didn't notice until we left, but their espresso tasted like poison. Ugh! They have an amazing selection of pastries-from sticky buns to cookies to scones and biscuits to filled brioche "buns"

Suuper delicious breakfast! Lots of options from fruit to paninis!The place is super cute in a beautiful street in Montreal. We had some granola with fresh fruits, fruit salad and poached egg panini & two lattes.Def, the wait was worth it!Delicioso desayuno! Un monton de opciones desde fruta hasta paninis!El lugar es muy lindo en una callecita hermosa de Montreal. Comimos granola con fruta fresca, plato de frutas y panini de huevo escalfado con dos lattes.Definitivamente, vale la pena la espera!

We had already eaten brunch earlier, but I was still hungry around 1:15 pm, and I wanted to get good food before leaving for the airport. Due to the overwhelmingly positive Yelp reviews, I really wanted to try this place so I added myself to the Yelp waiting list, and walked down the road in the rain (tip, it's about an 8 minute walk from the Courtyard Downtown). The Yelp waiting list does make it clear that it's not a true reservation, which I appreciated and it helped to set my time expectations. Upon arrival, I checked in with the host and she said it wouldn't be too long. I waited inside, due to the rain, and watched as people behind me got tables. At one point, she called three two-tops who were no shows, and then said any twos at all I can seat. A couple right off the street got the table. I guess with their creative community style seating, one single person doesn't rate and gets sat, not in order, but when they can find one stool in the corner of the restaurant to squeeze you into, which is what happened to me.I also was a host for years at very many restaurants and this is unacceptable. You could get a table of two who only drinks water and splits a meal and I spent way more than that. It's all a guessing game, you can't just discredit a solo traveler. Don't go out of your way to make one person feel not worth it. Rant over ... for now.Anyways, the menu is short, sweet and a little expensive. I got their grilled cheese with caramelized onions and homemade ketchup and nothing else but a napkin for $16 CAD. Was it good? Yes, and sweeter than a traditional grilled cheese in a good way, but five stars, not quite. I enjoyed two cocktails, their raz lemonade vodka, which was very good the first time and still good the second time but I'm fairly positive it had no booze. If I remember right, the drinks were $10 or $12 CAD. This restaurant is somewhat large, but they jam people in so there literally isn't any room to move. It's loud and you can't always find your server so you just try to order from the closest staff to you, especially when you are in a rush to catch a flight.Overall, here is my rating for my visit on 7/14/19 around 1:15 pm.- Wait list process: 2 stars (please fix this, and don't make single people feel ridiculous for eating alone) - Food: 3.5 stars you can tell they use quality ingredients, but the food is slightly overpriced and the sandwiches should come with some sort of side - Drinks: 4 stars, the raz lemonade vodka is quite yummy, especially when there's booze in it - Atmosphere: 2.5 - 3 stars, it's just too crowdedOverall: 3.5 starsWould I go back? Though decision but since I don't live in Montreal, there are too many other places to try, which I would visit or revisit first.

As one of the best reviewed places in Montreal, coming here for breakfast was a no brainier. The menu for breakfast seemed a touch sparse, but [personally I only had eyes for the infamous breakfast sandwich. When we received our entire order, I must say the coffee was on point and the sandwich almost met the sky-high expectations. The spice level was about 10-15% high for me, so if they calibrate it just a bit, I think it would round out the entire flavor profile of the sandwich a touch more.Lastly, they have several mouth-watering baked goods on display, and I wish I had the opportunity and appetite to try them.

My favorite bakery in Montreal, like seriously, we came back here the night before our flight home so we would have something yummy to munch on!We were lucky enough to catch the tail end of their morning offerings and beginning of lunch service which started at 11 AM.  We started with a selection of baked goods from their display case of yummineess located in front of the coffee bar area.  I felt like a kid in a candy store as I wanted to try everything!  We ended up trying the almond croissant, cheezy biscuit, blueberry tart, brownie, and another fruit tart.  We also ordered a latte as well as the homemade sweet ricotta, and the O+G Grilled Cheese hot panini.The almond croissant was a bit different than the ones I am used to as this one was skinnier, and longer more like the shape of a chunky cigar.  However, it was still flaky and had a nice flavor of almond in each bite, the shape also made it easy to eat.Cheezy biscuit was like eating an adult version of a Cheez-It, in biscuit form.Blueberry tart-So I typically don't care much for fruit tarts, but this was actually my FAVORITE.  The pastry was nice and flaky and the tart filling was spot on, not tart at all and not too sweet.  If they have any offerings with fruit, I would STRONGLY recommend ordering!Brownie-Hm, so I wasn't a fan of this brownie as it wasn't your typical ooey gooey chocolatey mess, but was more like a dense dark chocolate bar.  I am not sure if the texture was different because it was gluten free, but O+G does offer many gluten free options!Homemade Sweet Ricotta-I was hesitant to try this as I am not a fan of ricotta but this was absolutely delicious!  The ricotta was quite light and fluffy, and paired beautifully with the honey and orange rinds to compliment the yummy bread!  I thought this dish had the perfect balance of textures and flavors, especially with the surprise of the scattered grains of salt.O+G Grilled Cheese hot panini- Who doesn't love caramelized onions, and perfectly melted cheese?!?  This panini was just what we needed after all the sweets we devoured.  I think it would also pair very well with a soup!For those looking for a cute cafe with amazing pastries and offerings, look no more as O+G will satisfy all your wants!

Food seemed really good, however when I got there at 3 pm the only vegetarian option was a grilled cheese sandwich. I would have LOVED to comment on the other food, but unfortunately I can only comment on the grilled cheese. It was extremely heavy, really greasy, and pretty standard. It also seemed a little bit expensive for being such a plain dish. Overall, I probably only spent about 30 minutes in the restaurant. Service was quick though so that's a plus.

I try to pop into Olive & Gourmando each time I visit Montreal if I have the chance.The space itself is cozy and vibrant, usually filled with people having lively conversation. It can get super busy here at times so be sure to use the waitlist option via the Yelp app before you head over for a visit.When you first step in, the staff greets you then will take you to a table. As you walk through the restaurant, you pass by a tempting display of beautiful pastries and goodies stacked up on a counter behind glass.On my most recent visit, I ordered an Americano and enjoyed people watching while I savoured my drink.See you again soon, Olive & Gourmando!

Just when you thought all paninis were the same, here comes olive et gourmando. These were some of the best paninis I've ever had! I got the Cuban and my boyfriend got the bacon option. Mine was a traditional Cuban, but the type of pork they used was great. It wasn't dried out and the aioli sauce they used paired nicely. The bacon panini had bacon, thin slices of apples, walnut butter, and a heavenly combo of other ingredients. The bread they used was the perfect balance between being too soft and too hard.

Every time I walk past this place, it's always packed with people. It's gotten better since they added Yelp waitlist, so now the entrance and sidewalk is less crowded, but inside it's still always busy. They have a pastry counter inside if you just want something to go, and their almond croissants are really nice and flaky. Not too sweet and not too buttery.I've only been for a sit-down meal once when we walked by one day and it wasn't too crowded. It was pretty early in the morning. I ordered the "Poached egg on your face" and it was great! A bit spicier than I was expecting for a breakfast dish, but still good either way. The coffee was just ok, not really worth it in my opinion. There are a lot of other great coffee shops nearby you can stop at after breakfast if you need your caffeine fix. Overall it's a solid place, but I don't really get the hype.

Crowded!! Crowded!! Crowded!! All the time. Tried the to-go.Sandwiches are pretty good but love to enjoy them seated. Visited for lunch during family vacation to Montreal.Cajun Chicken Sandwich was tasty, flavorful. Mango slices gives twist to overall spicy flavor.Tried egg on your face sandwich, again pretty tasty. All sandwich are good for full meal and left over snack, pretty big.Tried chocolate cookie, almond croissant and citron white chocolate cookie - yummy but again many other joints in Montreal and Qubec City have similar quality. French baking !!

First time I ever used waitlist and wow, I am blessed now. Waitlist was showing a 31-47 minute wait for a party of 3 on a Sunday morning. My Airbnb was 25 minute away so I put myself on the waitlist (20th in line) before leaving. After parking, I was able to browse two surrounding shops before getting a notification saying my table was ready. I basically didn't wait at all. Pretty accurate estimation too. If you're going to come, definitely use waitlist. There were so many people the whole time I was there. I honestly had trouble getting in and out of the place with the amount of people there. So I'm not a sandwich person but it's highly rated even after over a thousand reviews so I had to check it out just to know. We ordered:* Cubain Panini ($15.25) - There's only one slice of meat and it honestly looked pretty disappointing when it arrived so I was really surprised when I bit into it. The gruyere was super gooey and the sandwich stayed hot the entire time. The sauce was really good too. If you're worried about it being spicy, don't worry. I cannot handle spice at all and I thought it was fine. I thought the flavours were really good but there wasn't much meat taste if that's what you're looking for.* Mr. Miami Panini ($15.25) - Least favourite item we ordered. Much bigger piece of meat when compared to Cubain but I thought it was too salty and wasn't anything special. I didn't use the pineapple jalapeno chutney because I can't handle spice but I was told it makes it a lot better. Group consensus was the Cubain was the better Panini. * #24 Salad ($18.25) + Chicken ($4.00?) - Pretty decent size salad and tasted pretty good but it wasn't anything special. I can definitely get a similar salad at many other places. * Sweet Ricotta ($11.25) -  Available until 4:00 PM. I honestly love ricotta. If you just scoop up the ricotta, plop it on the toast, it's so sweet. Literally like just orange marmalade with honey poured on top, nothing else. That's a lot of sugar so maybe push some of the honey off and it's bomb. Did I mention I love ricotta yet? Toast is yummy, ricotta is yummy, I love sweet things. Our total came to slightly less than $90 after tax which I thought was kind of pricey for what we got. It's not like the paninis came with a  side or anything. Just the sandwich. Priceyyyyy. Place was decent but nothing mind blowing and definitely not 4.5 stars good. Maybe idk what's good but I don't see what the big deal is about. I would wait at a lot of places but if you're going to have to wait more than 15 minutes max, I would say leave. Not worth.p

We had too high expectation before we tried from the reviews on yelp but we felt a little disappointed. The line wasn't bad so we didn't wait for long and the service was nice and welcoming but the food was just okay. When we arrived the most popular panini already sold out so we tried the Miami style but it was too salty and we didn't finish the Cha cha chia bowl since the strawberry sauce in the bowl was too artificially flavored. We ordered 2 pastries: chocolate banana bun and biscuit and biscuit was the best.

We LOVE this place!  This morning, we stopped in for breakfast and were seated immediately (it was before 8:30 am).  I had the Cha-Cha-Chia and a Hot Dirty Chai.  My companion had fruit & yogurt, an almond croissant, and a cappuccino - see photos.  Both dishes were so fresh and delicious!  The croissant was to-die-for.  Service is friendly & efficient.  By the way, this was our 3rd time eating there and we are always pleased.

No wonder this place is so well-reviewed by the 1000s!! This place feels like a second home! A marketplace of baked goods, coffees, salads, cold sandwiches, hot paninis, all-day breakfast and weekend brunch! Need I say more?!Location: 5/5A short walk from the Grand Quai and the Musée Pointe de Calliere in Old Montreal. This place is happening even for a normal weekday lunch!!Decor/Ambience: 4.5/5Very good use of space. Homey. Rustic. Earthy. There is a bakery at the front where baked goods and coffees are available to-go. Upbeat French music fills the air and a buzzing mix of conversations. Reservations is definitely needed for groups larger than 2, since this place is a bit small and most of their tables are meant for two only. I Ly is so popular among locals and tourists alike that we had to wait for 15-20 minutes even though we went in after 2 p.m.Food quality: 5/5My cha cha chia bowl was VEGAN and made from the freshest tasting ingredients like strawberries, coconuts, chia seeds, spiced bananas, and blueberries. Tasted so healthy and heavenly that I just had to close my eyes and just let the flavours dance around in my mouth. It was presented in the cutest glass jar. Almost reminds me of a parfait but without any of the fatty cream.I could come and eat this any given day.I also bought a chocolate banana brioche to go and was it ever rich in chocolatey banana goodness! Very flavourful, was not too doughy either.My beau ordered their O + G grilled cheese and my oh my did it all that cheese just melted in his mouth. Crispy toasted panini served out with ketchup on the side and gooey richness inside. Well done!I think for a sandwich place, they really try to cater to everyone possible.Service: 4.5/5We were seated as fast as they could have us. Our server immediately told us what's their daily/weekly special, followed by what's already sold out, and asked us if we have any allergies. Food was served pretty quickly, too. The staff worked very smoothly and fast as a team. There was no idling and still, they all smiled and gave off a positive synergy.Value: 5/5Fair price. I am so happy that I found a place that offers vegetarian or vegan options that are healthy, affordable, and sizeable portions. They also have big salad options, which I have to try the next time I am in Montreal, but wow, I am totally impressed with this place!Would highly recommend having a sit down lunch or brunch here and grab either a drink or baked goods to go if you happen to be touring/visiting Old Montreal or near the port area.

There was a 30 mins wait when we walked in. You can join the waitlist on yelp which we were unaware of. Anyways, we were hungry so we ordered a to go. We had grilled cheese panini, pistachio cake, almond croissant, strawberry biscuits, espresso shot and small mocha. We loved their almond croissant and strawberry biscuit. Panini was a little sweet as it has caramelized onions in it. It was a bit expensive as well, $16 for panini.

Best meal I had in Montreal hands down! They don't take reservations but I promise you it's worth the wait. While waiting, it was hard to restrain from ordering a pastry at the counter... huge sticky buns, Gouda croissants, beaver tails, and more. I loved the grilled cheese that had raclette cheese oozing out of it. I dipped it in the soup of the day which was red pepper with Gorgonzola cream and big fluffy croutons. My friend thoroughly enjoyed the ouffe coquette and repeatedly told me it was better than mine (lies). To end, we shared the blueberry pastry which was overloaded with chunky blueberry filling. The idea was to have mimosas but we were warned that their fresh squeezed orange juice didn't pair well with bubbly.. they were absolutely right but both were amazing on their own. The service was good even though it was extremely busy. You should certainly except a decent wait time. Even so we honestly would have gone back again during our trip if the restaurant hadn't been closed on New Years Eve and Day.

I can't say anything about this restaurant that hasn't been said before. High quality ingredients. Dishes that marry so many flavors well and is also like an artist's playground. The chefs and the masterminds behind these dishes create everything so beautifully. It's truly a special place, and it's not overrated. If you are visiting Montreal, Olive et Gourmando is not to miss.I had a giant beautiful French Toast mountain that was not on the menu. Check out the picture!

This place was very cute and the menu was very varied. There was a long wait when I came, but would definitely use the waitlist feature on Yelp the next time I went to try to save time waiting. The tables are very close together and it is quite loud inside. Also, they only have a finite amount of pastries and continued to run out of things frequently so get there early!

This is one of those places that is on every tourist's list and rightfully so. It's got all that old Montreal charm to it minus the onslaught of tourists that are inevitably waiting on line no matter the time or day. The prime time is brunch and if you're lucky, you'll score their infamous baked goods that tend to sell out by 11am. But not to worry, everything here is satisfying enough to forget you missed out on their specialties. It's lively, cozy, and rustic vibes will put any diners in the right mood to enjoy a good meal. Solid choice for a cafe but to wait 30+ mins(on a slow day, expect closer to an hour normally) can be somewhat off putting. Although you won't be disappointed with the food, it might be hard to justify the wait times. I'm a NYer and instant gratification runs in my veins, so I probably wouldn't want to venture here again after coming here a few times. It's good, but I'm over it. Stay fat mother suckers

For the brunch lovers out there and the ones who also like some sweet pastries! We visited this brunch spot on a weekend getaway to Montreal. It was recommended and we were excited because, brunch! Tip: We were super early on a Sunday morning (they open at 8) and so glad we got there because it was packed by 9:00 and people were still lining up (they also seems to serve pastries and coffee to go).It's a small space - more narrow than wide with communal style seating as well as smaller tables. When you first walk in, and you are immediately greeted with stacks of beautiful large croissants, golden muffins, and a variety of pastry deliciousness you don't want to look away. Then you are drooling and can't wait to be seated! I was told the brioche comes out at 9:30 or so. Sadly, I didn't get one to go and regretted it later on!As for service. Like I said, we were there shortly after it opened and were seated quickly and served just a fast. We enjoyed breakfast very much and I would certainly go back (early).

Another solid brunch place in Montréal. I'm honestly considering moving here because I'm so in love with the brunch scene in this city! Olive & Gourmando is yet another charming restaurant that I've had the privilege of trying here during my holiday. The entire staff was extremely welcoming and helpful and the food was great! My boyfriend and I initially wanted to try their lunch menu here but we came a little too early and ended up splitting their egg in your face panini along with the sweet ricotta. Nevertheless, the panini turned out to be delicious and the sweet ricotta was really something. Between the two, we both agreed the sweet ricotta was the favorite since it was just so bright and flavorful. I'd definitely recommend it if you're ever around for brunch!
The food was great. it had a nice street view. Panini was crispy outside and soft inside. It is worth it to try.
Wonderful in a very touristy location. Delicious mac and cheese! And it came with a nice salad!Top off with an incredible chocolate cookie! Bon Appetit!

I visit Montreal somewhat regularly because of work, and every time I'm here I have to come to Olive & Gourmando. The staff is super nice aNd everything is delicious. The vibe inside is very cozy and comfy and I just want to be there every time

Great vibe, stopped by for breakfast. Huge portions, short menu. I had the panini with poached egg. Enormous and tasty, my son had the fresh OJ and the chocolate banana brioche. Lines our the door, we used the yelp waitlist which shortened our time in line.

So good!! Ordered the Cuban panini while my friend ordered the Pomme panini- we both shared the chia seed pudding. Everything tasted great! We were both curious about the chia seed pudding so decided to share it. I don't think I'd order it as my main lunch item, especially on a cold day, but it was good. I echo others' comments about how the panini bread has the perfect crunch. I thought everything was fairly priced and service was good.Even on a Monday this place is packed so if you are planning on coming during a popular time, prepare to wait for a bit. It is worth it though!

Had the opportunity to go there in mid-February with a friend. It was freezing cold outside, about -25 Celsius, but since this place has such a hype around it, we decided we would wait until we got in to understand what the hype was all about. We waited for approximately an hour outside, despite it being 2 PM. One thing there is to know about this place is that it's TINY, even the seating area is tiny. They made us sit in an area in front of a window where we were next to each other and not in front of each other, which felt weird. If we were to wait for a table, it could've taken 10-15minutes more. It's also very crowded, and in the winter, it gets fairly loud and hard to hear the conversation you're trying to have. The food itself is good, but a bit overrated and overpriced. I'm eating a sandwich and a soup and I'm paying almost as much as a full meal at other restaurants. Also, it's not like it was the BEST sandwich I've ever had for it to be priced that way.... so I didn't get that part. I had the Mr. Miami sandwich with the soup of the day (which I specified to remove cilantro from and I guess they forgot). I wasn't surprised or really excited about the food, but the desserts were delicious and totally worth the price. I've had a blueberry danoise and a latte. The service was acceptable, they were very crowded so the waitress had a hard time going from table to table in a decent amount of time. It took 30 minutes to get the sandwich after we received the soup...

Place was packed for a Sunday brunch - we just went and got a few things to go. The lady at the front was very friendly and quickly helped us with our selection. The cheese scone, apple tart, and chocolate chip cookie with pecans were amazing!!! The cheese scone had a bit of a spicy kick to it. The apple tart was flaky and delicious. Totally worth the visit.  The price for three things plus a coffee cane out to $20 which isn't cheap but again, worth it. We came here on our way to visit the basilica.

If you're in the Old Port area in Montreal, I highly recommend stop by. Depending on the time of day there might be a wait, but it's well worth it. I used the Yelp app to join the wait list, so by the time we walked to the cafe we barely had to wait and got seated within 5 mins. I also recommend getting there in the earlier part of the day bc some of their goods sell out. I ordered the eggs in your face sandwich and the Cha Cha chia bowl. The egg sandwich was probably one of the best I've ever had. The chia bowl was refreshing and the granola that they use is homemade. Super yummy and ingredients fresh. The price reflects the quality of food, so keep that in mind. $13ca for a sandwich and $10ca for the small bowl is a bit steep but we'll worth it.

The first thing we did after getting off the train was make a B-line here for lunch. It was a 15 minute walk from the station, made a little more cumbersome with our carry-on's but it was worth it! I was initially disheartened to see the crowd waiting in line, but was pleasantly surprised when we got seated right away once we got the hostess' attention. I think it was because we were a party of 2 and everyone else was waiting for a bigger table. Lesson learned! Always ask!!My partner in crime got the Mr Miami ($14.95) and we both tucked in happily into the piping hot smoked beef brisket sandwich. The pesto and havarti brought a lovely creaminess while the salsa and red onions gave a hint of sweetness. I skipped the menu and asked for a cheese croissant and a palmier from the bakery. The croissant was perfect in texture (I should have asked for it to be heated up), and the Palmier was the sweet touch at the end of the meal. For those who don't know what a Palmier is, it's like the Asain butterfly cookie but much larger and with more textures. The outside is crusted with a sugary almond glaze, while the inner flakes are soft and buttery. Absolutely delicious. I would stop by just to grab one of these!!

Food: awesome in flavour, some may feel that portions are small but I found them very nice. My latte and egg panini was delicious. Menu is a bit small but there is stuff to choose from. I didn't like that some options were named funny and had no explanation.Prices: a bit pricey, but affordable.Wait time: A+ for online management of the line, it was very very helpful, but you got to be there by the time the app tells you, otherwise you may lose your hard earned spot. We arrived on time but still waited about 20 minutes before we sat down. Place: very noisy and hectic. The design is cosy though! Service: very pleasant, quick, but we didn't feel rushed. If that place wasn't named the best in Montreal I would've provably had my level of expectations a lot lower, but I anticipated the best, and still had to wait for a table, still found the atmosphere a bit too hectic and menu a bit confusing. Other than that - I'm glad I checked it out, but I will probably never come back.

This place gets busy very fast but turns around pretty quickly. By the time I got here, there were several parties in front of me but only waited about 15 minutes. Only had brunch and had a few croissants, the poached egg in your face panini, toast with ricotta, and a dirty chai. All very good. I wasn't sure where the poached egg in the panini was, maybe it got fully cooked when pressed in the panini maker but regardless everything tasted great.

Love this place through and through. The breakfast and lunch are amazing. The menu is solid without being overwhelming and their quality is stellar. We had the egg panini, the Mac cheese and the tortilla soup in addition to coffee and a turtle bar. It was amazing! Staff was very courteous and the line moved quickly. Def recommend the Mac and cheese! It was amazing!

This is the best Brunch in town. We are from Toronto and we especially drive down for a brunch at O & G. All items in the menu are great. I have had almost all the menu items. The poached egg in your face, the chacha chia bowl and the soup of the day are my favorite. The place is full of energy and positive servers. It will make you day brighter dining at O&G. All bakery items are excellent.

Been here a few times. Haven't been disappointed till now. My favourite is The Gustavo! Perfectly made and toasted panini. I also really like their roasted potatoes salad - so creamy and flavourful. Must try!

Huge fan! I'm blown away by the panini I ate earlier today!We came in around 12:15 on a Wednesday and somehow got seated right away (table for two) right before a huge lunch rush! There were people lining out the door by the time we left - we got really lucky.We ordered the Cuban panini with the soup of the day (housemade chicken noodle with peas) as well as their classic "Poached Egg on your face" panini. Honestly - WHOA! It was delicious! The paninis came out piping hot (I needed a napkin to hold mine). I loved being able to split them with my partner because they tasted really different.The egg panini was amazing, super packed with flavour, a little bit spicy, and just so delicious on its own. The Cuban paired perfectly with the soup and had its own unique flavour. We both felt being able to share made it better because I liked switching up the taste halfway through the meal.On top of that we got a coffee and one of their homemade cookies to go and it was delicious. Total cost for lunch was around $25 per person, but well worth it. The cookie (huge like the size of my hand) was $4.50 and we also got an almond croissant that was just okay.Overall loved it - would love to come back!

I was looking forward to this place for very long time. When I entered, this place looks really adorable even though it's super small. Everything around you is wooden. Very rustic feel! I was seated by the bar. It was nice, and comfy. I even get to talk to a person sitting next to me. The ambiance is cozy.My hostess was very nice and amiable. My server seemed overwhelmed because the place was full and super busy. Funny thing is, every time I would speak in French she would respond to me in English. I start talking in French automatically when I sense the person has a French accent; I don't why she kept answering me in English, because it was clear she is struggling with the language, unless she needs to practice.I ordered oeuf coquette from the brunch menu. It was not that good but it wasn't that bad either. The portion was perfect, but it tasted a bit too salty for my taste. What hurts is that this average size dish is about 20$. Can you believe it???! Anyway, I always wanted to try this place... here I got to finally.

Olive & Gourmando is a cute brekkie/brunch spot with delicious pastries and dishes. Chia pudding is amazing. The fresh fruits and mango puree are a nice touch. The muesli adds a great crunch. Banana chocolate brioche is sweet but not overwhelmingly.If the wait is too long, there were many people doing takeaway. So that is also an option.I definitely recommend for brunch before exploring old Montreal.

The panini they served is extra crunchy and the cheese and other ingredients inside makes is chewy. The rasberry lemonade was delicious and the almond croissant was perfect. It was a bit pricey for the food (around 20$ for a panini and a drink). The service was quick and the staff is nice. Make sure you don't come here on a tight schedule. The line at the door might be long, especially on weekends.

A very interesting spot. The wait staff basically says it's our way or no way...it's what's on the menu & it's exactly the way THEY want it. The soup of the day (tomato veg) was good but not overly great. The Cubano Sandwich was also good but not super good. Thought it would have been better based on the line up to get into this place. I doubt I'd go outta may way to go again.
Great panini and chai tea.  They were out of the croissants I went for so I was slightly disappointed but overall a good lunch experience.

This was one of the few bakeries in Montréal area I enjoyed. I came here with my husband for breakfast and I had their yogurt and granola. If you are a fan of yogurt and granola as I am you will enjoy it very much. What made this plate to me were the fruits . I'm  big on fresh fruit in granola they have that down packed here  and the yogurt and granola was deff homemade you can deff taste the difference. We also had their  chocolate chaud ( hot chocolate) and although it was good I wasn't too impressed by it.  There's deff better hot chaud in the area. Other than that the vibes were great and staff was lovely . If you do end up coming here try and get here by 9:30 am to try their best stuff. We got here around 10 and half of the bakery items we wanted to try were sold out.

Yummy brunch, got there at 12:30 on a Saturday and had to wait about 15-20 min. We got a pear and hazlenut scone, savory tart and homemade ricotta. All delicious. Was sad the two pastries we wanted were already sold old, the chocolate and banana brioche and apple tart... so go early if you want specific items.

I stopped by to get a snack while I was in the area. I got a chocolate brioche and it was tasty. I enjoyed the brioche and the service was great. It is a nice place to stop by to get a drink or a snack if you're walking around in the area. However it may be busy.

I dream about sandwiches from Olive et Gourmando! It's worth the hype and the wait. Sandwiches are large and I had ordered a soup too, needless to say I was stuffed! Our waiter had a ton of personality and took great care of us even though he was super busy. Be sure to pick up a pastry on your way out, I did and let me tell ya how happy I was to find in my bag later in the afternoon when I was hangry. That almond croissant hit the spot!

There was a long wait, but Old Montreal is a beautiful place to walk around while waiting. The food was good but not memorable. I probably would not go out of my way to visit again. So basically it is a classic brunch place, if there isn't a long wait - do it.

A must stop on a trip to Montreal or stroll through the old city!! We loved our breakfast at Olive & Gourmando on the recommendation of a local, and have shared it with anyone traveling there since. The cafe is such a cute space and we had no problem getting a table for two at noon on a Friday. There were smaller individual tables, as well as longer community style tables to accommodate parties of any size. We both ordered paninis, not a typical breakfast choice for me, but had zero regrets afterwards. The coffee and tea were great, but the food is what really shined. The egg panini was the perfect blend of "sweet" and spicy with the pairing of the meat and cheese, while the Gustavo was so rich and creamy. We both swapped off on each of the paninis and had nothing but rave reviews for both of them, you couldn't go wrong. For a not huge space, we weren't rushed out at all and got some great service.

I came to Olive & Gourmando upon recommendation of a friend who had recently visited Montreal.  Given the location, ambiance, and reputation, I wasn't surprised that there was a bit of a wait.  The host did a reasonable job managing the queue, although the entry area did get uncomfortably cramped, as many people waiting for their tables refused (for some reason) to wait out on the street, even though the host made an effort to call names both inside and outside.Upon being seated at a small communal high-top table, our order was taken in a reasonable amount of time: a few egg sandwiches, a pastry, coffees, and a side of fruit.  Our coffees were delivered soon thereafter, and my dining companion decided to order an additional pastry, which was -- (at this point in our dining experience) confusingly -- brought to the table before the one that had been previously ordered.After some time had passed, our server stopped by to check in on us, and we confirmed everything was fine.  As we continued to wait, we chocked up the delay in our food being delivered to the somewhat lackadaisical ethos of Québécois service standards.  Many minutes later, however, another server (manager perhaps?) stopped by to inquire if all was well.  I told her that we were simply waiting for our food, at which point she assured us it would be ready very shortly.She then headed towards the food preparation area to consult with our initial server, with both sharing furtive glances in our direction and the one consulting his order notepad with the other.  The second server returned to our table and asked if we had ordered anything in addition to the coffees and single pastry which we had thus far enjoyed.  We informed her of our full order, which had been placed probably 20-30 minutes prior, which seemed to come as something of a shock to her.  She assured us she would handle the error.Now, without having explicitly acknowledged it as such, it was clear that the initial server had neglected to put in our full order.  My expectation (perhaps unreasonable) was that the manager would expedite our ticket to ensure our already long wait did not become unreasonable.  Unfortunately, this does not appear to have been the case, as we waited an additional 20 or so minutes for our food to finally arrive.I will say that the food was thoroughly enjoyable, a generous serving, if a bit overpriced, but acceptable given the clear popularity of the establishment.  My issue here is that nobody ever acknowledged the error or offered much in the way of apology, and our initial server was never to be seen again, unable to own up to a simple and understandable mistake during a rushed brunch service.We decided ultimately to tip rather modestly, which unfortunately would not have been the case had the server/manager merely acknowledged the issue and offered, perhaps, to comp our pastries or drinks.

Still thinking about my breakfast here from last month's Montreal getaway. My Poached Egg On Your Face was the perfect combination of flavors and textures that has me salivating now just thinking about it. The bread had that toasted crispiness that made you want to take the next bite before you were even done chewing the last one. The eggs sandwiched inside were not-overcooked-and-not-overdone-but-actually-just-right. Then those roasted tomatoes, gooey cheese, and the perrrrrrfect amount of spiciness took this dish to another level. I'm not even a sandwich person and I could eat this thing on a regular basis. We enjoyed our meal so much that we came back the next day for the Cha-Cha-Chia bowl (also excellent) and warm Banana Chocolate Brioche fresh out of the oven. Thanks to the live waitlist on Yelp, we were seated immediately upon arrival for both visits. Great food, excellent service, and beautiful, rustic decor to boot! I want to drive 5 hours again just for that egg sandwich. Take me back.

I arrived at the restaurant around 12:00p.m. and it was already crowded. But the waiting was not long and got seated in about 10 minutes.I had Cuba Panini because the signature menu, Poached egg on your face panini was not available today. If you want to have specific menu, I'll recommend you to check ahead. Cuban panini tasted good. The bread was nicely crispy, harmony of the sauce and Gruyère cheese was great. But when you bite the other piece after finishing one, you might find it not that special or even bored. Servers were really kind and nice. They treated me well from the waiting area. Everyone is bilingual so you don't have to worry about French.The place is very cozy and clean but if you want to take a seat for a while, it is not suitable.

Yum!!!! Our favorite brunch experience in Montreal. (Tourist review here) There was quite a wait when we got there, it was snowing so everyone was bundled up inside. A place for coats was nice. Decoration was kind of random and they had a chalk board wall behind the coffee/sweets. i'll post a picture because that's a lame description. But it's so cute and perfect!They cranked people out pretty quick though so we really only had to wait about 20 min. We tried a handful of pastries, and both of us got some delicious marinara/spinach/ goat cheese(?) chorizo dish. with grilled bread and an egg on top. omg. we're going back to Montreal just for this spot! Keep up the good vibes

I had the afternoon to myself in Montreal and decided to explore a bit. But first--lunch! Olive & Gourmando appeared to be a great option in the heart of where I wanted to putter around so I pointed my cab driver in this direction and away we went. When we pulled up in my cab I saw the long line of folks waiting outside and I grew immediately concerned. I just wanted something tasty but quick so I could get to wandering. Sure enough, the wait was about 30 minutes. But, lucky for me, since I was solo diner I was able to be seated right away at the window bar in the back of the restaurant.It was super tight back there and not a lot of room to move, but it was quite alright because I wasn't there to linger anyway. I ordered a sandwich (The Pomme) and an iced tea and settled into my map to figure out where to go first. After a few minutes, my sandwich came out, smelling amazing and looking delicious. The Pomme is a panini of sorts filled with double smoked bacon, housemade walnut butter, sliced apples, garlic vinaigrette, and cheddar. So so good. It's also HUGE. I could only get through 2/3rds before calling it quits. FYI-- the bread gets super crispy from the toasting/press, and I totally cut up the roof of my mouth trying to wolf that thing down. No regrets, though! After I finished I cashed out and ordered a latte and a sweet treat at the coffee bar inside for the road. The pastries looked amazing and I almost bought a few to take with me but I didn't want to be bogged down with bags while sightseeing so I just got a chocolate turtle bar in the end. This was maybe my highlight of the trip here. I have a real sweet tooth and this did the trick. It had a layer of thick, dark ganache, followed by a layer of pecans mixed into a gooey rich caramel, followed by a buttery shorbread base holding it all together. Damn good. I wish I had gotten another one for later. Latte was also really well done.The space is small but cozy and the decor, a mix of wood with a flora and fauna feel, felt welcoming. I'd definitely return here on a future visit. I'd just plan for a wait if I'm not flying solo.

Two words: Just go. It is worth every bit of the wait. I lived in California for a decade and have had my share of good salads--this salad was something else. Also, try their pastries even if you don't like pastries. Just order one. Drool.

Very very busy restaurant, especially in the AM.  We got on the yelp waitlist and it took 45 minutes to get a seat which was very convenient.  The food here is on the healthy side so if you want fried eggs and ham or a burrito go somewhere else.  I truly enjoyed my chia pudding and everyone else loved their sandwiches. Their baked goods are to die for as well. The bill came to almost $80 US dollars for 4 people so its not super cheap.

Had the best brunch here. Small place but they can fit more people with their communal tables. Started with almond croissant, lemon blueberry scone and apple turnover. The almond croissant could've used more flavor but the other two were terrific. I had the Mac and Cheese with mushrooms and truffle tapenade with a side salad. A great balance with the two items on my plate. The Mac and cheese was flavorful and didn't feel heavy. Loved the crunchy topping. My daughter had the grilled cheese with the homemade ketchup. Normally would not eat it with ketchup but this was sweet and a nice compliment. The raclette cheese in it was a nice bonus. My friend loved her oeuf croquette. A busy place. Loved it!

This is an awesome restaurant in Old Montreal. It is always busy, so be prepared to wait a bit, but the quality of food and service and atmosphere is definitely worth it. If you have the Yelp app, I recommend you get on their waitlist as this will expedite your seating. The gluten-free food options are a bit limited; however, what they have was excellent. The restaurant has been operating in Old Montreal for 20 years so they know what they're doing. Originally, it was a bakery and still is; however, it's also now an awesome restaurant. The menu is quite simple and they just do an awesome job at the items they offer. Everything is made fresh and many of the items will sell out during the day, so don't delay if you see an item you really like. We visited this establishment twice during our visit as it was so good.  On my first visit, I had the Mr. Miami and my wife had the Salade Verte Pollo with extra avocado. The highlight, though for me, was the potato salad side. This is made fresh so be prepared to wait. However, it's the most amazing item on the menu for me.  The restaurant uses a team approach to service and all associates are extremely friendly, outgoing, and happy to assist in anyway. The restaurant is small, but I counted 10 associates serving that guests.  They're all very informed on gluten-free and other food allergies.  The restaurant tends to be a little bit on the noisy side as you would normally experience with a popular and great restaurant.  The music, atmosphere, and ambience is very chic and cool.   On our first visit, we were tucked away at the front window which gave an excellent viewpoint for people watching and greater privacy and insulation from all the action.  Definitely this is an awesome restaurant and a must visit for anyone visiting Montreal.

Well the hype is real and this is a quite yummy experience.  Friendly helpful staff make the experience even better.   The egg in your face panini had just the right kick and the Summer Very cocktail made it a great brunch combo.  Things were so good , we stopped back later for a coffee / dessert after a full day of shopping .  Add this place to your list and come early before 10 to reduce wait !
The house made ricotta and poach egg sandwich were to die for. Probably my favorite breakfast ever. The latte was also very good though am not much of a coffee person.

I've sent so many people to this place. All the tourists who visit my shop I send them over and highly recommend but seriously, this policy of no table if you're alone sucks... I'm a little turned off and disgruntled!

Stopped here for lunch while spending the day in Montreal. The place is small and was packed however we were seated within a few minutes.Service was great and our server was very friendly. Everything came out quickly. Only complaint I would have is that they don't seem to have AC and the day we came it was pretty warm.I had the brisket sandwich and my girlfriend had the grilled cheese. Both were excellent but I liked hers even more. Soooo cheesy and good.Before leaving we picked up a large chocolate cookie and a muffin. Both were very good.

Not a huge breakfast or brunch person, but the savory options are amazing and far beyond what I could prepare myself. Fresh, crispy bread that doesn't feel heavy. Just phenomenally executed.Knocking off a star because the pastries aren't to my liking but a matter of preference. The texture is more heavy and doughy than I prefer my viennoiseries, though the taste is decent. Next time, I'll skip the sweet stuff and go straight for their savory sandwiches and tartines.Oeufs Coquette - Two poached eggs in creamy dill sauce, with tomato, chickpeas, avocado and some other stuff. Rich but tempered with the tang from the tomato sauce to balance it out. Bread was really tasty too.Ham & Cheese Tartine - A nice slice of bread, toasted and with the structure to hold up the savory ingredients. Well balanced, savory, satisfying.Tartine - The cheese really pulls it together. I'd say there's too much raw vegetables going on that don't get blended in well but otherwise very good. Enjoyed the freshness of the ingredients, almost like a salad on top of the bread.Cuban Panini - Really hit the spot, high quality ingredients, the cheese, ham and mayo come together well without overwhelming.Chausson Aux Pommes - A fairly tasty apple turnover, but not mind blowing. My favorite of the viennoiseries I had, the puff pastry was as expected. The filling was not too sweet (a good thing), real apple chunks and a juicyness without being soggy, coarse sugar granules coated the outside.Chocolate Brioche - The bread was very heavy and dense, I was expecting lighter and more buttery. Pastry was a bit on dry side. A miss for me.Almond Croissant - Denser and sweeter than I expected. It's heavy and bready rather than the light, flaky puff pastry.

Excellent brunch!  Went soon after it opened on a Monday morning to avoid a long wait.  Drip coffee was decent, cappuccino was excellent.  "Poached egg on your face" panini was one of the best breakfast paninis I've ever had - slightly spicy, but not overwhelmingly so.  All of their pastries looked fantastic!
Long wait but worth it!  Delicious Cuban panini and very unique potato salad.  Loved the flavors

Our flight came in very late at night, so in the morning we were needing some food to get us fuel to explore..walking to St Paul street we see people waiting outside, so curiously we head in and put name down for 2..really cool inside, totally authentic vibe! We got the blueberry biscuit, which was amazing. We then ordered egg in your face, which was big enough to split..coffee was very good, however no refills.  However they give you cream which was much needed a d welcomed..great place

I had the pleasure of having breakfast here twice last week, used the waitlist on yelp to get a quick table upon arrival.  I liked that.  Ambiance was awesome, plenty of local friendlies and tourists.  It is in old Montreal after all.  I found it to be more of a bakery menu for breakfast and brunch, also had a larger lunch menu I believe.  On both days the experience was  good without being overwhelmingly great.  The fruit platter with pressed yogurt and honey was really delicious, drip coffee was average, as was the croissant.  On the second day the cheese scone/biscuit was delicious, double espresso was also very good, and the poached egg panini was good though it turned into a surprise for me as I was expecting a poached egg meal without the extra bread.  I would advise a careful read of the menu.  Service was excellent on both days, I would come back again.

We tried both the Cuban and the Poached Egg paninies - both were excellent. The bread had the exact crispness that you long for, warm on the inside with tasty meat, sauce and cheese dancing together. Cuban is more salty.Ambiance was nice, we waited 30 minutes (2 people) on Saturday morning 11am.This place is definitely popular with local and tourist visiting. Also a good place if you just want to buy pastry coffee and take them on the road.Went to this place again the second time, ordered Miami - more balanced than the Cuban.Hot chocolate was small, almond croissant was good but not exceptional.

Absolutaly Deeeeevine! You know that place wheee the food is so good you wonder how they did it, this is it!! We started with the almond croissant to share and we all thought it was good, but not great.  So we were a already thinking the food wouldn't be as great as all the reviews say it is...wrong!!!The vegetarian sandwich...WOAH! The salty ricotta...omg omg! The corn which accompanied the ricotta was like nothing I've ever tasted perfectly blended with pine nuts and a citrus dressing!  And they serve it with this grilled bread which is also like nothing I've ever tasted!  We also ordered the grilled cheese and it was also good! My mother would approve of this place!Next time I'm saving room for some of their sweets...the cookies also looked delicious but there was no more room! They do run out of items as I wanted the eggs Benedict and they were out-so come early if you can!

We really lucked out in coming here early on a Saturday morning, and just beating the morning rush.  Olive & Gourmando is a great place to grab a delicious baked good for the road, or to sit and have a nice meal in a lively cafe.  The baked good alone in the front make your mouth water!  But ordering from the menu is just as mouthwatering.  I opted for the Cha Cha Chia bowl, and my friend had the Brioche of the Day. Both were perfect, as was the side Almond Croissant!  I recommend getting a few of the baked goods for the road, and yes - be prepared to wait in line! But it will be worth it!
Best vanilla latte I had while in Montreal! The cafe is adorable and felt rustic. It was a nice place for breakfast and coffee. I only wish they had more egg options, or dairy free options.

The first word I would use to describe this place is overrated. We put our name on the waitlist here at 12:15 and the estimated wait time was 30 minutes/ we were 17th in line. We arrived at 12:45, checked in with the host who was great, and waited. At check in, we were 9th in line. We waited an additional 30 minutes to be seated. The restaurant is really crowded inside, so your options are to sit on the benches they have provided outside in the sun with zero shade OR stand across the street in the shade provided by an adjacent building. We chose the latter. After being seated, we ordered pretty quickly. I had the grilled cheese and potato salad. Both were good, but not worth an hour wait. My advice is to pop by here and if the wait is more than ten minutes, move on. You can find a grilled sandwich anywhere.

We came here for a late breakfast on a Thursday and we were seated right away. It was either going to be an adjoining table right next to a couple or at the window. We chose the window so we could drink our coffee while people watching the narrow, "cobblestone" street. Very cute decor and friendly staff. Coffee-- very bitter, not the best by a long shot Poached Egg on your Face-- closed panini sandwich, with a kick. Large portion. My friend and I could have just ordered one because we both only finished half. I would suggest to share! Ultimately it was not my favorite dish and I wouldn't order it again. I feel like it's hyped up. There are other things on the menu I would try, but this visit fell short of expectations.

May have been a bit hyped for me. I tried the grilled cheese, and the most special part was the house made sauce it came with. Definitely great sandwiches, but did not think it was worth the 90 minute wait. However, you can put your name down, and stroll around town while you're on the waitlist since the restaurant is in a very central part of Montreal! They also sell a nice variety of pastries that are great to snack on while you wait.

When the restaurant we planned to eat at was closed we found this place close by. It was very busy on a Monday afternoon,  but we chose to stay. The wait was probably 15-25 minutes and then we were seated. Our waitress was friendly and prompt in giving us water and taking our order. I tried the Elixir Iced Tea which was so delicious and the Big Healthy Salad 3.0. The salad was fresh and crunchy and I enjoyed the spicy pumpkin seeds which really added to the overall flavor. My friends order the Cuban panini and Mr. Miami panini which they both enjoyed. If you're looking for fresh and flavorful food this is the spot! I'd definitely recommend it if you are in the area.
Good place for some healthy breakfast fare, as well as yummy pastries. Our waiter, British guy, was charming and attentive.Go early, they get crowded and can run out of popular items.

Well; this place is beyond. It will fill your heart with some happiness. You'll eat the best panini and the almond croissant  yum yum yummmmmmy! The service is amazing and the coffee is the best so far in Montreal

I was very excited to try this place out because of all the hype surrounding it. Right in the heart of old port. They don't take reservations  I went with a friend who's been there several times and she says the wait can be very long. We were lucky to wait about 15 mins. It's a cute little coffee shop/resto. They have a small menu that's limited with what you can order during the week and weekend. They have a lot of salad options. I decided to go for the grilled cheese sandwich. I didn't enjoy it much because of the caramelized onions that were quite bitter. They serve it with their house ketchup which was very good. I also ordered a latte which was the perfect drink to have after work on a windy day. My friend ordered a salad with bread. I loved their bread. It was very soft and tasty.
