The best part was the extra large cookie we had for dessert. It was cold though and we asked if they can warm it in a microwave and they said no. However we still enjoyed it very much! They have a huge selection of baked goods and patisserie. My friend recommended to go their on the weekend for breakfast which I will probably. I wasn't too impressed with their menu or food. The server said it changes with season, so everything my friend had in the past wasn't available. Our server was very nice and helpful explaining the menu and our options. The place is quite packed, almost claustrophobic. It is nicely decorated with a woodsy theme. The resto closes early, so no options for dinner. Easily accessible from metro. Very, very close to the water in old port.

This little cafe is life! The lattes were delish with a leaf looking foam design on top (photo worthy). Next the croissants were INCREDIBLE ! I would recommend the cheese option. Soft, flaky, sweet and savory.I also tried their "Cubain" panini. I didn't think a panini could be sooo tasty! The flavors combined are out of this world that it definitely leaves you wanting more. My only wish would be that the location was a little bigger. It gets pretty busy and you could end up waiting 20 min or so but it's still worth the wait. If you're visiting the Montreal area this should be on your list!

This place is AWESOME. Take the best Croissants, Brioche and Biscuits you have ever had (buttery,  flaky, moist and savory - in all the right amounts)and add great service and a cool vibe. You cannot skip this one if you are in Montreal  - simply the best.

A really good breakfast and brunch spot nestled in Old Montreal. The food and ambience was great. I ordered the "Poached Egg on your face" panini for breakfast and a hot "Dirty Chai". Both of them were equally good. Definitely would recommend O&G to anyone visiting Montreal.

Very hip place. Very busy. We did not wait long for a shared table but it was about 2pm on a cold Sunday in late  November. The service was excellent. Mimosas to start ! The grilled cheese panini and egg on your face panini were excellent. Coffee very good also. Pastries looked great. Would have loved to try their crunchy granola but at $25+ too expensive !

Easily the best lunch I had during my trip in Montreal!Even though this spot was packed to the brim during lunchtime, the wait wasn't too bad (about 15 minutes).My sister and I ordered the Cajun Chicken sandwich and the Summer Garden Salad to share.When the sandwich arrived, I instinctively started picking out the orangey-yellow slices, until my sister told me to "STOP" and then I realized I was picking out mango slices, not cheese.Thank god my sister stopped me before I picked them out, because the sandwich was UHHH-MAZIN'! The mango was perfectly ripened and sweet to counterbalance the savory cajun chicken.The garden salad was phenomenal as well. They don't gyp you on the greens and lentils. The salad was flavorful, had a spicy kick, and was super filling. This salad is definitely not an afterthought on the menu.Service was friendly and prompt, and Olive & Gourmando was the perfect spot to watch the long queue for the Kendrick Lamar pop up shop at the Phi center across the street.100% recommend this place. Make this your lunch spot when you're in Old Town!

4.5 stars. Food and baked goods on point.Made our way here on Canada day. Got there around 11, was told it would be a 45 minute wait. Perused and walked to the basilica (and even went in) and made it back and waited about another 10-15 additional minutes  past the original 45 min. No biggy, though. Place is small and loud and bustling.Food: Poached egg on your face panini. Perfectly cooked eggs, with a little bit of a kick to it. The boyfriend got the pizza pocket and that was deliciously warm and kind of sweet. Both sandwiches were reasonably priced.What takes the cake here are the desserts. Although I was bummed because they didn't have the banana chocolate brioche, we tried the raspberry white chocolate brioche. That pastry was all around soft, sweet and tart and just very, very delicious. Also took a chocolate cooke and lemon poppy seed cookie home and those were moist, tangy, and rich. I love their pastries.Service: Awesome. Friendly. They take american credit cards too.I would definitely come again the next time I visit Montreal.
Over priced! You basically get a grilled cheese sandwich for $16. A $22 salads that is less than three mouths fulls. Not a good deal!!!

The best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. My husband and I came here for breakfast and split the "eggs in your face" panini and a chocolate croissant. The egg panini had spicy sriracha and ham on it with the poached egg chopped throughout. SO GOOD. A must when coming here! The chocolate croissant and cappuccino were of high quality and baked fresh. Might go again tomorrow!!!!

Coming back from an afternoon at the Montreal Botanical Garden last Friday, we decided to find a place for a late lunch in Old Montreal. We saw that Olive & Gourmando had high marks, so we headed over on the metro. The place is small, but crowded. There was about a 15-20 minute wait. We were seated along the window which was fine because we could people watch.My friend ordered Mr. Miami which she said was good. I ordered The Majestique. It was a huge entree, but it was so good. The apple coleslaw and pickled corn+jalapeños were delicious accompaniments. The slaw was more sweet & tangy rather than jalapeño spicy. It was one of my favorite meals in Montreal.Service was good and they accept credit cards. I would highly recommend this place!
Good food, although, I got the wrong order . Great location. Service is too slow.Food comes super hot and they don't warn you

What an incredible breakfast experience.  First the coffee; we had cappuccinos and the foam was so rich and thick that the sugar sat on top and melted into it.  Great cup'a!!We sampled a butter and an almond croissant, banana nut muffin, maple pecan brioche and sticky buns.  Everything was fresh and moist. Delicious!! Also, while we sat there, the table next to use had  their savory sandwiches brought over and I immediately got food envy.  Wish I had more time in this city :( I would definitely come back here for lunch. The place is very clean and really well run with a super attentive and friendly staff.

Pooh and I biked from home to Old Montreal and decided to come here for breakfast.The place was packed. We sat at the counter.The coffee was strong which was a nice surprise since a lot of restaurant coffee is pretty much the same.We both had the Oeufs Coquettes. The name is misleading since tbe dish has only one egg and an extra one costs $2.50.It was delicious but a little too fancy and expensive for what you get.

Olive et Gourmando is an institution in Montreal and needs no introduction. There is always a line (it's a good thing!) So just hop in line and catch up with friends/family while you wait. We were seating at the bar area in front of the windows and enjoyed a delicious toast with a mountain of chopped vegetables and cheese with a delicious coffee. We also ordered a number of pastries to go. This is a special place, make some time to stop by.

Delicious healthy breakfast options. While the menu is limited, all of the options were delicious. We ordered the poached egg in your face Panini which was slightly spicy and very filling. The Cha Cha chia pudding was fruity and delicate. Two great options to split!

Olive & Gourmando, a hidden gem near old Montreal, truly captured what it means to be a great local restaurant. The food, ranging from beautiful pastries to crusty sandwiches to a decked out hot dog, stole the show, while the atmosphere added to the experience of a great place to eat. Olive & Gourmando is the perfect equation: close enough to old Montreal+not being a tourist trap+a trendy atmosphere+fairly priced food=a great place for breakfast, lunch, or late lunch (I believe it closes at 4). My family ordered the Mr. Miami sandwich, the Cuban sandwich, normal and almond croissants, and the hot dog. All of the food was incredible, but my favorite was the Mr. Miami--salty, sweet, crusty, and warm. I'd definitely recommend it. Although the almond croissant was not my favorite (it was a bit less flaky and more sticky than the normal), it was still tasty. The decor in this restaurant ranges from hipster to woodsy, and it works perfectly with the cool yet laid back vibe. If I came to Montreal, I would definitely come back for a cute and tasty brunch/lunch.

I came on Monday around 12:30pm, it was super busy. The waiting time was around 20mins for table of two. I heard the staff told bigger group the wait time is 1hr or more. So it shows don't bring a big group here during the peak time.When we sit down, the egg on your face already sold out. We order "Mr Miami" and "The Cuban"The waitress are so busy and very efficient. The food was served in super hot (it's hard to hold it at first). You can tell it just came out from the panini machine.  The taste is amazing on both sandwiches. I'm so happy with our food. After lunch, we order Coffee and cappuccino with brownie. The coffees taste ok but not as amazing as the paninis. The brownie is very strong/compact chocolate. Very sweet which goes well with black coffee. It's taste but it's not my favorite one. And it was kind of hard to eat. I will guess it was not their strength point.

We came here on our first morning in Montreal. We were just visiting for a few days, so we just researched on a lot of reviews and then came here based on that. We were able to find street parking nearby just one short block over, so that was no trouble. This place is in a really cute little area of Old Montreal so the buildings around are cool to see. Upon arrival, we did have a short wait in a scrunched line by the door, but it went pretty fast and I'd say we were seated in around 10, maybe 15 minutes. The spot we ended up sitting at was on the corner of a long bar on the window and it was very intimate and close, but we were able to see into the kitchen and watch our food being prepared, so it was kinda cool. Only the getting in and out of the spot was a bit uncomfortable. Overall, this place had a cramped feel, so if that isn't your thing, maybe skip.Service-wise, everything here was great. They helped us English-speakers with an English menu and served us in English so we didn't have to use our poor French! This is the norm in Montreal, but still good to know going in if you don't speak French, just say so and they'll get you an English menu and help you in English. Food though, oh man! We had a butter croissant and a cheese croissant and the fresh ricotta with bread. The cheese croissant was the best croissant I've ever had. It was so buttery and flakey it left a sheen of butter on my fingertips and had such flavor. The cheese one compared to the plain butter was just so much better because the cheese gave it such a nudge up in flavor that really completed it for us. The fresh ricotta was so light and perfect for starting a day with a lot of eating, which is how all my vacation days go. It was beautifully presented with salt and the flavor was really well-balanced between the honey and the cheese and it was just really good. Totally glad we stopped here, it was a wonderful introduction to the food scene of Montreal.

This is the first restaurant we tried.  I still get nervous when I have to speak French.  But the menus are in both French and English side by side which was a relief for me since it's a popular place.They are quick to help if you have any food allergies and since I'm non-dairy I was thankful for that.  The Cajun chicken sandwich is tasty and not overly spicy.  It had just a little diced jalapeño in addition to the spice rub.  And their iced coffee is small but strong.  Would definitely come back!

Fantastic food .. friendly staff .. gluten free cookie & chocolate brownies are amazing .. coffee is decent .. hot sandwiches- Especially Spicy Poached Eggs, Mr Miami & The Cuban .. all 3 are must try !!

Fast serves...best hot chocolate I've had since I've been in Montreal.. Banana chocolate brioche was very chocolate so it had the dark chocolate bitter taste so I couldn't eat the whole thing, and honestly bananas are my favorite so this item was over all ... deliciousLove the design of the restaurant a little old fashion with a hipster vibe to it... also it is very noisy so keep that in mind

I love the paninis they serve! Best ones I've had in Montreal. Tried the Cuban & Mr Miami and they were both so delicious, both packed with so much flavour. I'm amazed at how crispy the  bread is and also I just love how the cheese melts so smoothly. We also tried their brioche, my bf loved it. I'll definitely come back to try the rest of their paninis!

I've come here twice, with about fives years in between. There is no greater comfort than returning to a place and finding it just as lovely as when you left.Saturday brunch is a perfect thing to experience. Everything on the expanded brunch menu sings. And no matter how full you are, get a croissant to go.

My friends and I stopped by here for breakfast to kick off an expectedly long day. It was a bit crowded, but we were seated rather quickly. Seating is tight, but the decor is cute and lovely to look at. Our server was energetic and on her toes, fluidly switching between English and French. We were served relatively quickly, and our food was beautifully presented, delightfully delicious, and perfectly filling. I'd recommend this quaint place to any fellow Montréal visitors!
Customer service was great and the wait wasn't long. Very busy place with a great atmosphere. The Mr Miami panini was a winner. Everything I ordered was fresh.

We found this wonderful breakfast thanks to a Yelp search in old Montreal. So glad we did!It was a busy morning but we got seated quickly. Service was fairly quick and coffees were served promptly. All the food hitting tables around us looked delicious and ours turned out to be delicious. The Egg on Your Face panini was soooo good. We were warned it was going to be spicy but it wasn't really, just yummy. The granola had half an apple grated on it - super fresh and filling. The best part was the chocolate banana brioche. It was rich and thick without being heavy and dense. I'd love to come back and try more but sadly the trip was too short.

This was my favorite meal in Montreal and that's saying something because we were spoiled with good food there. The service was very good the food was the best! I had a Big Healthy Salad (pictured) my daughter had the Heirloom Tomato salad and my mother had a Salty Ricotta plate. All were excellent right on the old city, so convenient to go to while seeing the sights! Highly recommend and I'm hard to feed.

I DID IT! I FINALLY TRIED THIS PLACE!OMG it was a long time coming and you know what? Worth it! Checked it off the restaurant bucket list.I know this place gets a bad rep for the price, wait, and service.The food is insanely expensive. But I think it's all part of their business model. They are so popular right now and tourists are willing to pay that much so why shouldn't they charge that much? It is going to stop me from going often but it did make me want to try it.The wait time is ridiculous. My Boyfriend and I got lucky, we only waited 15 minutes on a Sunday afternoon. I left my name with the guy who does the seating and he told me it was a 30 minute wait. So we left and walked around for 15 minutes before my boyfriend told me we might have a chance at getting in earlier because people probably don't show up for their reservations and he was right! We got in ahead of 3 other couples who were no shows. I thought the service was slow but I understand that with the volume of people, it gets a little hectic. I personally thought everyone was really nice and helpful.Now, the food!I got the soup of the day. Black bean with porc and yoghurt with some avocado and tortilla chips. It was great! Best soup I've had in a while. It was super creamy and tasty. Made me feel full and happy.My boyfriend got the OG grilled cheese with a green salad. The salad was ordinary but the grilled cheese was delicious! It had caramelized onions which I'm usually not a fan of but they were excellent. It also came with some homemade ketchup that really complemented the grilled cheese. The food is worth it in my opinion. But don't go with a group of people or with friends. Go with someone you know who doesn't mind waiting and doesn't mind the prices. It's really not for everyone and I was lucky my boyfriend enjoyed it. It's not family friendly since the space is so tiny and the seating so limited.

We came here for lunch the first day in Montreal and then breakfast on the last day. Cute restaurant in Old Montreal. It does get very busy so if you come on off hours this is your best bet for grabbing a table. For lunch I had the soup of the day which was a squash and lentil soup. Oh my gosh this was the best soup I've ever had. Along with the soup my friend and I shared the grilled cheese sandwich this was the perfect lunch. I was nursing a cold so I ordered a hot spiced bourbon drink which was also very tasty. We came back for breakfast a few days later. The breakfast menu is a bit limited. That time I ordered the egg on your face sandwich without the speck. Good but not mind blowing.
Great environment!  Good looking food with average taste.  The price is a bit high for the food and the service is average.

My fiancé and I walked around the neighbourhood trying to find a good place for breakfast/brunch, we read the glowing reviews on yelp and decided to come here. We arrived at about 9am on a Sunday and it was already packed, there were two groups of people ahead of us waiting in line. Still, the waiter was able to sit is within 5 minutes.The water came quickly, and the waitress took our order right away! Here's what we ordered:1 coffee1 orange juice1 almond croissant 1 chocolate croissant 1 Oeuf Coquette ( poached egg with tomatoes and feta crumbles)1 Tartine ( stacks of cucumber, roasted squash, asian pear, nuts, herbs & honey+lemon+Aleppo pepper dressing on top of homemade ricotta and a huge slice of bread).. okay, in hindsight, we ordered way too much food.. but it was definitely worth it! Everything was super fresh and tasty, and they are very flexible with customizing your order. I asked for my poached eggs vegetarian ( it usually comes with chorizo).Seeing other yelpers' reviews on paninis, I wish we had gotten that as well!!We will definitely go back to try more items:)

[LOCATION] - 4/5 Located on Rue Saint-Paul Ouest and Rue Saint-Pierre at Old Montreal. Parking spots were hard to find, so we had to park a few streets away from this place. [SERVICE] - 5/5Our server was friendly. The wait time was 45 minutes, but we left our phone number so we could walk around, and the hostess gave us a call 5 minutes before our table was ready. [DÉCOR] - 4/5 Very small, intimate, and homey vibes. There were a lot of people when we went at around 2PM on a Saturday. They had a takeout area for pastries and hot drinks if you just want to order something to go, or while you wait for a seat. [QUALITY] - 5/5Fresh ingredients and homemade recipes. I totally understand why this place was so crowded! The food was really, really good.  [ORDER] - 4/5- The Gustavo Panini - $14.95: BEST. PANINI. EVER. The yogurt & roasted garlic marinated chicken was so juicy & complemented the roasted mushrooms and grilled red onion. The whole panini was glued together with with maple and Dijon mayonnaise and melted Havarti cheese. - The Cubain Panini- $13.95: Basically a next-level ham and cheese sandwich. Pancetta (Italian bacon) and roasted pork were very flavourful but a little too salty in my opinion. The lime and cilanto cut through the richness of the pork and melted gruyère cheese. The panini was brought together with a tangy pickle mayonnaise. [OVERALL] - 5/5Before I came here, I thought a panini was just a panini. But boy, I was SUPER glad I tried the ones here. Although both paninis were delicious, The Gustavo was much juicier and the medley of flavours were better than The Cubain. Overall, this place was worth the wait, and I would definitely recommend The Gustavo Panini.

I highly recommend this place for breakfast or lunch! Top 5 places that ice been to. Pastries are fresh and espresso is bomb! Tomorrow I leave Montreal and i will be stopping here for breakfast again before i leave!

The best panini I've ever had!  (Make that paninis)Yelpers you know when you get something special and must write about it! This is/was the best restaurant we tried in Montreal.  The food is delicious!!!  Everything is fresh and made there and you can taste it in every bite.  The place is cozy with small cafe tables, crowded with people, the delicious smells dancing in my nostrils.  You will want to eat everything you see, I wish I had more time in Montreal I would have gone back again...next time! My tastebuds were having a party and wanted more!Mr. Miami panini 5 starsThe egg panini 5 starsCuban panini 3 stars, although tasty compare to the other two it lacked flavor (suggestion ad spicy mustard and real pickles to compliment the spicy pickle mayo)Green salad 5 stars (best salad I've ever had) They had run out of croissants...I really wanted one!Service 5 starsFood 10 stars if I could give itPrice 5 starsAmbiance 5 starsOverall experience 5 stars sOmg, O&G, I'm going to miss this place!The Real Foodie You had me at Panini

So this may have been one of the best breakfast meals I have ever had!  The pastries were phenomenal and the specialty coquette was perfect.  First time in Montreal, but if the restaurant scene is like this everywhere, I can see why people brave this weather to fill the eateries. Recommend getting here early on weekends as the wait seems to build fast, but the staff seems efficient and cooperative to make it run smoothly. Our waiter was very friendly.

Have heard so much about this place from friends. Have been wanting to try their cold veggie sandwich, but by the time I got there I settled for a blueberry scone and an Americano. Being a baker and being fond of scones I must say this was one of the flakiest, layered scones I've had. What I did wish for was for some spread of some sort (some cream) on the side. Call me snobby, but one has to have something to spread on the scone as you sit and sip on a nice cup of coffee or tea. And when you're paying close to $5 for a scone, you deserve it;) maybe even warmed up as well. Might go back to try their cold vegan sandwich, but would be more tempted if they had a hot vegan sandwich on the menu, especially when it's cold out and you're looking for something warm.

Everything is homemade here (mostly I believe!). I ordered a Cuban sandwich- essentially a glorified ham and cheese sandwich. The bread is toasted to perfection, crisp without cutting your mouth. The spread was just right, I thought the ham was actually bacon... but it was plain old ham. Cheese was a fantastic portion. Overall, a great panini, but you're paying for the price. I also ordered a dirty chai to go-perfect to combat the Montreal heat wave. Would come back again for some hearty homemade food.

All I have to say, it is wow. This place is delicious delicious. Seems like everything is homemade here. The raspberry lemonade you could tell was homemade and not too sweet. They play great music, the service is delightful and again another place to check out while you're in old Montreal
I've been here a few times and I always get their spicy breakfast sandwich and it's just delicious!

Yuuuum. We booked a reservation on yelp 10 mins before getting there and got a table really quick. The host let us put our big luggages under the bench in the front area since the restaurant seating is tight.I had the "egg on your face" spicy panini with a side of really dill-y potatoes. Both were AMAZING. I had an iced dirty chai which was pretty good but I kinda regret not getting a regular coffee.I will be back and next time I'll need to try something new.

The space was quite crowded on a Saturday morning! But their coffee was heavenly!! The Mac and Cheese was delicious and simply perfect for a cold winter morning. I enjoyed my meal and was happily full for hours after. I didn't enjoy the salad the came w/ the Mac and Cheese tho - had a particular dressing or smell that didn't please me. The Oeuf Coquette (Poached egg, tomato, feta, crumbled house chorizo, avocado + Olive's grilled flat bread) was not bad but didn't meet expectations. If I'm in the city next time I would prob pick up coffee and a baked item from this spot.

The best pastries in the city. No question. I can totally see why this group continues to grow. We had almond croissants that had the perfect level of sweetness and crunch. Our little guy had a chocolate croissant which he loved. Great coffee as well. Can't recommend enough!

both the coffee and food were delicious. love all the vegan options here as well. the chia seed pudding was amazing as well as the vegan sandwich. the cafe has a nice feel and cute interior. definitely recommend!
**warning cannot make customizations to any menu items**Overall this joint wasn't worth it .. after checking in we had a 30min wait for some mediocre food

There is so much hype and social media posts about this place I had to go. Not at all what I was expecting. The skinniest croissants I've ever seen, and the coffee was not good. So many other coffee places in the area,  don't waste your money. Disappointing.

Cozy brunch spot with great atmosphere. Only reason four and not five stars is I felt the menu was a bit small. We had a great window side seat. Coffee and mocha were excellent. Highly suggest using yelp to reserve a spot in advance
-food is amazing, especially their almond croissant and paninis-service is very friendly and warming-price is affordable, not cheap but not overly priced as well!

Super cool ambience with a really warm feeling vibe. We came in around 5 pm and there was no wait, but they were out of a lot of the menu items, such as all cold sandwiches.Regardless, we were here more for coffee and some sweet bites. GET THE PALMIER! IT IS A GODSEND. The berry pie bar was very dense, but in a good way. We also got the pistachio lemon bar. Just the right amount of sweet and tart, and I loved the crunch the pistachios gave in the middle. Finally, the citron cookie also had a bit of a coconutty flavor to it. The lemon was obviously not as pronounced as in the lemon bar, but the light tinge complemented the white chocolate chips well.Their cappucino and drip coffee came in big portions, and tended to sway more on the bitter side. Not in a bad way though! I quite enjoyed it. Anyways, would love to come back and try their sandwiches, but even their last pick baked goods were delicious.

Delicious and a great locationSwung by and seated by the window with a great view of the government building and museum across the street.For starters we ordered the calamari. There were only two pieces super tender calamari with a yummy vegetable sauce.The main course was the Cornish Hen for two. This was a deboned Cornish Hen prepared with a sous vide that was stuffed with risotto in a cast iron skillet accompanied with purple potatoes, brussel sprouts, carrots, beats, and broccoli. Upon serving, the waiter poured a cup of the sauce on the hen and it was fabulous. I wish there was more for the vegetables. The chicken was fall off the bone, if there were bones, tender. The best were the two drum sticks

Our concierge recommended it to us and we loved it. Long wait (Saturday brunch around 2PM and waited a good 40 min) but really enjoyed our meals and treats! We split the healthy salad and egg in your face panini, both I would order again. The service was good, they seemed to have an overflow of hands on staff which never left you waiting for a refill etc. I didn't love my citron scone but truthfully it was a random choice for me, my BF loved his maple pecan brioche. Latte was mediocre. Would highly recommend a wknd brunch here!
Best breakfast place we went to in Montreal! Appears busy but they are quick to turn over tables and the food is worth it!! Top of my list to visit again.

Fantastic, friendly service.  Yummy panini, croissants, coffee and Sunday morning spritzer. Definitely worth it. Be prepared to wait, especially on Sunday breakfast/brunch. Better venue for smaller parties.

So good had to visit twice in 3 days! This place was recommended by the concierge at our hotel, so my mom and I tried it for breakfast.  It wasn't too busy when we got there so we sat down and had the Valrhona chocolate brioche and almond croissant.  Everything was so great from the pastries to the coffee, the servers, music, and atmosphere that we decided to go back for brunch.  The brunch was just as amazing, definitely get the breakfast panini (i forgot what it was called) it was so delicious! If you're in Montreal, definitely stop by this adorable buzzy place.
THIS. IS THE BEST. SANDWICH. I'VE EVER. HAD. It was, I think, the vegan 2.0 or something like that but DEAR LORD it was good. It'll take you a while to get seated, but my friend, IT IS WORTH IT.

Excited to try this place after looking at so many great reviews. We opted to do take out since it was so busy on a Sunday morning and our order came up fast. The Cuban panini was wonderful, it had a spice to it with the meats added in the sandwich. It was big enough to split if you're not too hungry. Lattes are on the weaker side here, we ordered the large size but it just seemed as if there was only extra milk not espresso. So many different things to look at when you walk in and a wide selection of desserts and pastries.

What's great about this place is that they text you when your table is ready so you can go walk around nearby and come back when it's your turn to be seated. The place itself is a little small and crowded but the food is worth the wait and tight space. I would recommend the mac and cheese; it's delicious! The wait staff were great as well.

Amazing food! We shared the grilled cheese and super heathy salad and it was the perfect balance. The grilled cheese is heavy so half a sandwich was more than enough. The almond croissant was okay nothing to write home about. The dirty chai was just the way I like it - flavorful but not too sweet. Would definitely recommend this place for lunch! Keep in mind they don't take reservations and it's first come first serve and your entire party must be present to be seated.

This trendy cafe in Vieux-Montréal has tasty food and a fun (albeit crowded) atmosphere.I came at 9 am on a Sunday morning, and they already had a line out the door. I didn't stay for a sit-down meal (I just got my food to go), but the restaurant had nice decor and looked like a cozy place to start the morning (provided you could get a table).I ordered the chocolatine and the highly-praised "egg in your face" panini. The chocolatine wasn't that good - not sure if I'd recommend O+G for pastries - but the panini was amazing. It was loaded with eggs and meat, and it had just the right spice level (usually French food has zero spice). It was a delicious and hearty way to start the day.So if you're hankering for a tasty breakfast, give O+G a try - just make sure you arrive early!

user_city: Saxtons River, Town of Rockingham, VT
user_review: The 20-minute wait for Sunday brunch was very much worth it. This is a cheerful, artfully decorated spot in the charming old brick-clad neighborhood of old Montreal. Yes, it's true that the banana-chocolate brioche is yummy, but they also have wonderful salads and sandwiches, including the intriguing offering of grilled cheese with ketchup and caramelized onions. I enjoyed the Cuban, oozing with gruyere and slightly spicy. Overall: Classy yet casual. Possibly crowded. Lovely. Yummy.

Went for brunch on a happy sunny, and very busy Saturday morning. Waited 45 mins for a table which wasn't a problem as there are many nearby interesting boutiques and galleries to explore! They seated us at a very tight table for three that was super uncomfortable and felt like we were always in the way. We were starving, so ordered an assortment of the pan fried panini type sandwiches, and juices and coffees. Everything was delivered promptly, great quality and taste, but we really couldn't fit the food on the table at the same time as the drinks, and there was no way to address the space issue, except to hurry up and eat and leave. I'd go again, but maybe during the week when it's not as crowded perhaps.
Stopped in for a late lunch and coffee. I had the Cuban and my mother had the same. Both were very good.

This place is amazing.  Super complex flavors on every plate.I had the egg on your face and my fiance had the french toast. Both were done amazingly.  The coffee was delicious and so was the bread.  There is always a wait, but its worth it.Staff was very friendly and helpful with the menu.  If the weather was nicer I would have gotten a coffee and pastry to go. and head down to the water. If you are in Old Port, this is the place for breakfast.

Sad for me, this spot is so popular that arriving at 2pm on a Friday was still too crowded to have a spot for lunch. After having lunch across the street, though, we came back to oggle the pastries and grab an iced coffee. It was definitely the smallest size for the highest price I had seen in the city, but it was also one of the tastiest. Definitely worth stopping in, and good luck getting a spot.
Great place for brunch. Small place but the line up moves quick.Had the Mr. Miami panini and the #24 salad.Salad was great, the panini was good but a bit on the greasy side, overall good experience.

This place is INSANELY popular. Insanely. As in people are crowded into the front section and spilling out into the streets, waiting. There's an online waitlist which they don't pay attention to, so don't bother with that. I suppose everyone who's visiting sees all the reviews and wants to try it out. Fair enough, that was us too. As a side effect, they can charge what they want. There's i think only 4 sandwiches subject to availability with absolutely no changes. Technically, if you're assembling a sandwich, how hard is it to leave off a pickle? But i suppose for the sake of streamlining and getting through the crowd, they just keep pumping out pre-assembled sandwiches and heat as needed. Essentially this is a coffee shop style casual lunch spot that can charge what they want cos they have the demand. I got the egg on your face sandwich which was certainly quite tasty. I expected an oozing poached egg, but it seemed to be diced small and sprinkled on, which was fine. But, $16 for a sandwich and no sides... 4.50 for a biscuit, cookie or choc croissant and 5 for the almond one everyone raves about. Essentially 25% more than most other places. So $22 for a good sandwich and pretty average choc croissant , strikes me as really quite expensive and I just did take out!  Add on a coffee and maybe a side and you're closer to $40, which is a bit much.  Anyway, if you want a good, creative sandwich and you're happy with the premium charge, go for it. The coffee is really good, but the crowds are a pain to deal with.

Decent place to grab breakfast and brunch although it can get crowded. Plus they've got some really strong coffee if your into that. Would definitely recommend the ricotta with orange marmalade if your getting something off the breakfast menu.

They changed their menu often which I appreciate. I remember going the first time and I raved about the beef brisket panini and a shashuka dish. I went again the time after hoping for a similar experience but I was so disappointed. Nothing too crazy or different about their breakfast sandwiches and their sandwiches are premade so we couldn't ask for anything without cheese. The best thing we ordered was a potato salad side, it was warm and flavourful but still nothing extremely out of the ordinary. Overall super cute place and it's usually packed, I personally haven't gone back since but you should try at least once.

Best panini to get is the Mr. Miami. You won't regret it.Tried the chocolate and banana brioche and the strawberry lemonade. The brioche is big and was mildly fresh when I got it around lunch time. Banana was closer to the middle of it. The lemonade was good but not worth the price. Really go here for the panini. The salsa sauce is amazing, very fruity. It's worth it.
Yummy Panini's.  Great vibe!  I was there for breakfast and loved it so much went for lunch the next day. You'll love it!

We came here for a quick lunch and cappuccino and it was well worth it!   The place was very busy. We waited about 10minutes for a table. The food was great, I would recommend the Cajun Sandwich. Lost a star because of the dirty cups. Next time we will do take out and not eat in.

This place is a gem!  Found it on Google maps while doing research for my trip to Montreal.  It's not very large which makes it super cozy for cold Montreal days.  The rustic veggie soup was perfect for warming me up on the below freezing day.  The chia totty was even better!  If I make it back to Montreal I'm definitely heading back here!

Food was ok.  I do not think it was worth the hour wait.  We had Mr Miami, soup of the day (tomato chipotle), Cajun Chicken and House salad.  Of all these dishes, the soup of the day was the best.  The other dishes were good but not the best I have had.  The restaurant is clean and service is good. The pastries look amazing.   Would I come here again, probably not.

This place is crowded on weekends but it worth the wait time. The grill cheese sandwich is out of this world, the taste and texture are AMAZING. The restaurant is cozy and beside the good ambiance the service will be in my A list. If you want to have a good breakfast experience don't skip this place.

Drip coffee was bitter. Very quaint place with excellent food. There is little seating in the shop but the wait staff is very friendly. Menu doesn't have a lot of options but they have perfected what they make. The chia bowl is tasty with great granola and fruit flavors. The egg sandwich is one of a kind and has a special tangy spiciness that is enjoyable. All of the pastries were excellently baked. Portions were very generous of all food stuf

Cute, bustling restaurant with a simple but delectable menu. Bit too crowded for comfort in the dining room. Loved the restaurant, menu and vibe, but it was so busy and cramped. Good problem to have ... for them. We loved the menu even though it was very carb-heavy as another reviewer mentioned. We enjoyed the stellar selection of baked goods, great coffee, loaded granola yogurt, and the paninis. Really wanted the poached egg panini, but they were sold out. Experience would have been better if we weren't packed like sardines in there. Service was friendly but forgetful. Our server didn't provide some essential items like utensils, napkins, and side plates for items, then cleared them too soon and never brought more out. It was difficult to reach her during our meal. It's definitely worth a visit, but expect a tight squeeze. I recommend going during off peak hours or grabbing a coffee and pastry to go.
We had a great breakfast consisting of croissants and granola.  The design and atmosphere is very cool.  The baked goods are excellent. Service is good and the coffee was hot!

The cutest, most quaint breakfast and coffee spot in Old Montreal. Beautiful interior. Clean and inviting. Delicious array of pastries and other baked goods. Their breakfast sandwich was spicy, gooey and so tasty!! Cappuccino was just right!

Great place to have brunch. It's pretty busy (even during snowstorms)Food took quite a bit to come so we order a pastry while waiting for the warm food. (It was really good).Some things can be a bit too spicy, but other than that everything was delicious. Sandwiches are pretty big. So if you're not too hungry, or you don't eat a lot, they're shareable.Dirty Chai was interesting, and hot chocolate was good. Service is friendly and changed one of the orders for no charge because it was too spicy.

My husband and I DID NOT speak to each other the entire time we ate our food. It was absolutely delicious and all together life changing lol. He ordered the Mr. Miami and I had the Vegan 3.0 paired with beer and freshly squeezed orange juice. I am so surprised how delicious the Vegan 3.0 was considering it's not an all vegan establishment and generally vegan options aren't this tasty. Both sandwiches were generously sized. There was a bit of a wait to get seated but it's totally worth, you don't want to miss out on this food !

Simply amazing sandwiches are great especially the classics. I still nice the sleeping sandwich. Any regular will know this one. Please return this please The Salted Ricotta is amazing. I prefer the winter salad it used to arrive with lightly cooked root veg carrots etc with an amazing vinaigrette. Best ever even to the green salad and that's still great.My only issue here is trying to get in.
Delicious!! The grilled cheese has grilled onions in it, and comes with a side of sweet ketchup. Very good! The hot chocolate was not too sweet and has a good chocolate flavor!

My friends and I came here back in January on a vacation trip to Montreal and if there's one thing I miss the most since leaving, it's absolutely the food here! I don't even know where to start! Upon entering, we were greeted by a friendly waiter who let us choose where we wanted to sit. Of course, we chose the window seats!My boyfriend and I are vegan's so we were a little worried that they weren't going to have any options or they were going to have just one. But let me tell you, we were so wrong! I ended up getting the Vegan (a flavour packed cold sandwich) and he chose the vegan salad with tofu. Let me tell you, as soon as I finished off my last bite, I started having withdrawals. My friend got The Gustavo and I know it was good because he didn't speak once until finishing it off!This cute place is the place to go when you're craving flavour!

I've been to Olive and Gourmando three times and have had a great experience each time. The prices has increased since the first time I've been which was two years ago which makes sense. The panini are a must! The cuban is by far my favourite! If you're craving something sweet, get their ricotta. It's a mound of ricotta with honey drizzled on top and toast. It is delicious! Make sure you get there early on the weekends for brunch! If you're in a rush, you can always grab their pastries or coffee to go!

Yes, the wait is long since it's highly reviewed but definitely worth the wait. The atmosphere is friendly and very well lit with natural daylight coming in from their side windows. The Cuban Sandwich is delicious but definitely filling, you won't be able to eat appetizers and finish the sandwich. I also recommend the Vegan Sandwich, it comes with a side dish of hash browns, very delicious. Definitely worth the wait, just don't be starving on the way there.
The paninis were absolutely amazing.Everyone in my family loved the Cuban the most, while I thought the Miami was the best.Both amazing though!!

LOVE THIS PLACE!!! I cannot recommend it enough, and it's no surprise that it's on every "best place to eat" list out there online. Reviews don't lie and neither does the food. I went here on one of the coldest days of the year and was a little nervous that there would be a wait. There was, but not for long. After about 15-20 minutes for them to call and let us know that a table was available - not long at all if you're accustomed to typical brunch culture, lines rounding street corners. We were seated quickly thereafter and got our cappucino's, which were amazing!! (I would recommend getting the large size if you're going to have a meal as well). The menu is small but everything on it sounds amazing! I ended up getting the poached egg in your face panini which was to die for!! I cannot recommend it enough. Definitely a must-try. It has the perfect amount of spice, just enough to add flavour, and the cheese was just perfectly melted. The portion sizes here are also great and will keep you full. My mom ordered the salty ricotta! The ricotta was so fresh and lightly sweetened with the honey and orange zest. The bread they served with it, perfectly crusty. After reading much about the croissants and how amazing they were we ordered the almond croissant as a side and damn, it did not disappoint. It was perfectly flaky and buttery. I can barely describe it without wanting another. All I can say is: ORDER IT!!!!!

Came here for an 11 am brunch on a Wednesday. The place was crowded and rustic. Very small. The waiter initially told us we needed to wait 45 mins for a table of 5, then suggested splitting us up which would seat us immediately. It was super awkward. My friend and I went to a table while the other 3 waited. There were clearly tables that we're going to be empty very soon, but he seated us at the other end of the restaurant. After my friend spoke to him he came and got us and voila! A table for 5 magically appeared. It was a crummy awkward start to the meal.The service was pretty horrible. We grabbed our own menus. No one explained anything to us (like how we can order off the breakfast as well as the lunch menus, and they were 2 physically separate menus). I ended up getting the habibi chicken sandwich. The only egg option was the poached eggs and they had RUN OUT OF EGGS. I was in need for protein. Unfortunately they also didn't have French toast. The sandwich was cold (yes I get it it's called a cold sandwich but it was too cold), jam packed with a handful of dill!!!! Wow way too much. It was overpowering even when I tried to scrape most of it off. The latte was good but wasn't hot enough to my taste, I don't enjoy lukewarm coffee.I won't be coming back here and I don't recommend this place.

If I could, I would give it a 4.5 without an issue.After walking past the restaurant a few times around lunch time and seeing a near constant line and it being packed inside, I knew I had to try it.  Ended up coming in for breakfast just as they opened then next two days in a row.Both times I had the same thing...."Poached Egg On Your Face" panini and the Green Tea Elixir.  While I personally would have loved an extra slice of prosciutto and a little more poached egg, it was an absolutely delicious panini.  The bread used was absolutely amazing and the use of farmers cheese just makes it a perfect compliment for the sandwich.Also the Elixir iced tea made up of green tea, ginger, and lemon was just a great morning drink for someone who doesnt drink coffee.  Could drink that everyday (and in fact, I found a recipe by the owners of Olive & Gourmando of how to make it when I returned to the States).Also despite how busy the place was, the waitresses are phenomenal.  Super friendly and attentive. Dont even try to rush you to open up your seat to move new customers through, in fact both times I had to notify them I was ready for my check rather than them asking if I was ready (which is far more traditional in Europe than in NA).Fully recommend it when in Montreal and I will be back.

This cafe is lovely! Great ambiance, service, food and drinks.I ordered an elixir which is a black tea with pomegranate and ginger. It was divine! I had it with a gluten free cookie that I am still dreaming about, 4 days later. It was filled with coconut but that made it so, so good. I also ordered a brownie, which was a bit on the richer side. Would love to come back here for a proper meal or maybe to spend the day and do some work. This is the perfect cafe in every sense.

Olive & Gourmando is a very cute bakery/breakfast spot located in gorgeous Old Montreal. The glass display hosts croissants, scones, cheezy biscuits, and other delicious looking things. Their croissants are absolutely perfect - the butter croissant was a beautiful, velvety texture and I swear each bite was just a mouthful of flaky, delicious butter. I had an almond croissant for breakfast that was, again, flaky and wonderful, but also the perfect amount of sweetness. My latte was fantastic with a rich, creamy foam that was SO GOOD. I wish their menu had more of a selection though or offered sides like 2 eggs because it's a really carb heavy meal. Regardless, you must come here and treat yourself to a delicious baked good (or 2 or 3) and a latte. On my way out, I grabbed a lemon pistachio bar that had cranberries in it and was so rich and perfectly tart and sweet. This is a great place to grab breakfast and then walk off the calories around this beautiful neighborhood.

Would give 3.5 or 4 stars for food, but rounded down because our order got mixed up twice. First, was the drinks - we didn't want shots in our lemonade or iced tea, and they both came with shots of gin. I asked to switch mine to one with no shot, and my friend kept one with the shot cause he didn't want it to go to waste. Our server had offered to charge the regular price for both drinks, but when the bill came, the alcoholic one was $12 and the regular was $4.50. We had also ordered two sandwiches on whole wheat, and they both came on white. We didn't even bother letting our server know, as we didn't want to waste the sandwiches.Besides that, I thought the ambiance was great and the food was good. We ordered the roast beef panini sandwich and the cuban pork one. Hands down preferred the roast beef one. Would've loved to try the cajun chicken sandwich too, as it was on a different thicker fluffier bun (the table beside us ordered that one and it looked awesome).Got some pastries to go - berry square and strawberry rhubarb muffin. The berry square was really good, the muffin was ok.All in all, I think this is a neat place, but not sure if I would wait in line again for a table here. (We went at around 2pm on a Friday, and the wait was half an hour. Can't imagine what the wait time would be at noon!

The most crispy panini sandwich I ever eaten so far. Very good flavors- we tried the Mr. Miami and eggs in your face.  Also tried the cheddar biscuit, almond croissant and plain croissant. All very good. Coffee and latte were great too. Just solid place for a snack or brunch before you go out to explore Montréal!

It is true that when you see a line for a place, the food is good. We had to wait for 15 minutes to put our name on a list to wait for 20 more  minutes.  BUT it was well worth it.  There was a beautiful case of fresh pastries.  The sandwiches had crisp quality ingredients on fresh bread.  One sandwich would have been enough for two to share. BTW..you only get the sandwich, no chips, no pickle, no big deal.  We ordered a bag of chips and shared with the next table.  The service was friendly and attentive.  Bookmark this place for a must do in Montréal.

-TIP INCLUDED ON BILL-Decided to come for lunch Time with a friend it was snowing and packed which is always a good sign as long as you aren't all squished in. We got a seat at the window with a bar table style which was the last open seat. I was skeptical at first but it was beautiful at the big window with the snow falling. Reminded me a bit of Paris (love the old port.) great view !Staff was friendly and smiley and knew her wine which is always a plus.It's not a cheap place two salads and a sandwich a small hot chocolate and wine was 70 $! BUT they added the tip to the bill which we forgot about when we read the menu so we left 80, not a huge deal but do be aware this time you don't make the same mistake as us.The Cesar salad with chicken has kale in it and a light dressing (home made dressing) and lean thinly sliced chicken with bacon and croutons and capers of course.The Cuban sandwich was really good had this pickled mayo and thinly sliced meat and cheese. The salad 24 was a tofu salad with Asian noodles and peanut butter dressing. It's a really good salad if you want something light and healthy.

The Egg on Your Face panini is the finest breakfast sandwich I've ever had. Flavor so nice I ate it twice! Seriously, Kim made us go back again the next day to get another. She was being kinda mean to me this trip, but this breakfast made it much better.

A must! This place has a great vibe and amazing food! It put my Shazam to work, their music selection is awesome which sets the mood for a good dining experience.I came too late for the cold sandwiches but the OG panini and Ricotta salad was on point! I'll be sure to come back for the other popular menu items.It's also close to the Basilica so if you visit, fill up and walk 5 mins to one of Montreal's top attractions!
INCREDIBLE.Fresh ingredients, great service, amazing energy. LOVED this spot. This is the epitome of good food. A must stop while in Montreal.

WOW! What a FANTASTIC breakfast!Make sure to get here early, or at least be willing to wait up to half an hour for a spot during the busy hours. This little bakery/coffee shop/cafe is super cozy and loaded with superb breakfast offerings. There are lots of windows that the staff will open up on mild days, and the space is warm and inviting.You can certainly grab a pastry and cappuccino to go (their pastries are sooo good), but if you stay it's best to get a mix of dishes so that you can try a little bit of everything. My husband and I shared the ricotta toast and the yogurt & granola bowl. I can't believe I am rating a restaurant 5 stars of two dishes that might be some of the simplest food you can eat. HOWEVER, Olive & Gourmando serves up some of the lightest, freshest dishes you could ever ask for. Their ricotta toast comes with whipped ricotta, sprinkled with honey and orange zest, served along with thick, oh-so-delicious toast. The yogurt and granola bowl was the best I've ever had. Fresh yogurt and even fresher fruit. Being from America, I am used to all the (what I call) "sad" fruit; melon, grapes cantaloupe. Here we had blackberries, blueberries, black grapes, strawberries and julienne apples. What a great combo.I could've eaten at this place every day of vacation, and kind of wish I had. Definitely check it out.

Súper crowded, elbow to elbow sitting room. Sandwiches taste okay but way too expensive for what it was. Had to go to another restaurant afterwards because we were still hungry after a $45 bill. Waited forever for the bill and by then we were antsy to leave. The waitress insisted we all go sit back down at our table so we can pay (one bill). After going back and forth about why we need to physically sit at our table, we obliged her stupid request. Another waitress just walking around looking at her shoes the whole time we were there. Make yourself useful- it's the lunch rush. Never going back.

We were very happy to find this place for lunch after visiting the history museum. There was a 20 minute wait for 2 people at 1:30, so we killed time in some shops nearby. The space is quite small, so you need to be aware of your surroundings.I ordered the mac and cheese, which had mushroom and truffle oil in it--delicious! The cheese was very creamy and flavorful. The side salad was a nice balance to the meal. My mom ordered the baked eggs, which seemed similar to eggs in purgatory or shakshuka. It was also very flavorful and packed with veggies. The triple chocolate cookie was the perfect end to the meal, especially since it was still warm.Definitely stop in for lunch if you're in the area! The staff and servers were very nice, and they were able to accommodate us with our rusty French.
Great food. Quality ingredients. Nice dessert/coffee bar. Just long lines. Slightly on the expensive side, but probably the best place for a casual lunch in Old Montreal.

I really don't think this place can get any better.   Once again it was recommended to me by some Yelpers and I'm glad I had the opportunity to visit.  It's located in Old Montreal and is simply a must do on your visit.  They have fresh baked goods, coffees/tea and do serve brunch/lunch.  Here on a weekday and later in the afternoon - about 3:30pm it was about 3/4 full.  I can only imagine on the weekend that this place must be hopping so definitely try to get here on a weekday at on off time.The brunch/lunch menu had my mouth watering - everything sounded so delicious but as soon as I saw the mac & cheese I knew that is what I had to get.  And boy am I glad I did!  It was tiny bursts of flavour explosions in my mouth - it had mushrooms in it, all this delicious gooey cheeses that provided a beautiful bite without being heavy.  The top was all gorgeous and crispy - I literally savoured every bite and scrapped the dish clean!  Just thinking about it makes me want to go back.  It was a tad bit on the salty side but I can forgive that.  It comes with a small salad that has pine leaves in it that gives it a nice finish - it;s also lightly dressed which I totally appreciate as I find most places douse their salad with dressing and it just ruins it.With a glass of vino, and some tea afterwards this really hit the spot.  The mac & cheese was $20 - yes a bit pricey but I'd get it again and again and again.  I made the mistake of ordering a 6 oz glass - that alone cost me $12.  A rip off but oh well.  You learn.  Service was a bit slow when I entered - you wait to be seated but I felt like I was a bit ignored for a few minutes but I'll let it slide because I just loved my meal here.  Plus afterwards it improved as the server was attentive and made recommendations when I was trying to decide between a few dishes.  She was also nice enough to let me know (as well as the other patrons) that the kitchen was closing at 5pm so if we wanted to order anything else to get the orders in now.I'm already looking forward to coming back!

Really yummy & fresh food!! Only thing I would say is to get there on the earlier side since they seem to run out of things on the menu as the day goes on. Seating can be a little cramped but it's super cozy and they play great music as well!

Finally able to dine here after many attempts due to the long lines.  Delicious pastries with gluttony written all over them!  Well worth the wait to sit in this quaint place and indulge in a tasty brunch!  The  cinnamon brioche was a favorite as well as the delicious fruit, yogurt granola. Get there early before everything runs out!

We had breakfast here on a rainy day~ It is as beautiful as it is tasty. They are on top of clearing tables, adjusting their baked goods all while maintaining a very casual and comfortable vibe. We each ordered the poached egg panini and coffee drinks. We both commented that we could have split one, but we also had no problem eating the two we ordered! We thoroughly enjoyed our meal in this happy place. Our server was very friendly and made us feel comfortable and shared a story about his wife. Really lovely place that earns it's great reviews. Great music playlist too~

Lovely place. Our Cuban panini had this yummy jalepeno pineapple salsa. We also had a salad full of goodness and the cocktails were spot on. The vibe was coffeehouse-like. Our server, friendly, helpful.
Holy moly it's SO good. Panini will never be the same again. A whole other level of goodness!!! Must try when youre in Montreal!!!Had the Cubain and a latte.
Food and service was good, the only reason I gave 4stars because of the panini was too oily but other than the place was so cute and cozy..
A fun and cozy place for an tasty breakfast. If you want brunch, it's only available on the weekends. Croissant was amazing and the yogurt and fruit was as fresh as you could want.

Olive & Gourmando was my favorite of all of the stellar brunch spots that we tried in Montreal. The food was delicious, but most of the city seemed to think the same thing judging by the large influx of people on a workday. Still a nice find in a nice city. The long and short of it:1. Sandwiches. I had the "Poached Egg on Your Face" sandwich and can honestly say that it was easily in the top 5 breakfast sandwiches I've ever had (and I loves me some breakfast sammys). The sandwich was on the larger side (had to over-eat to finish it...... no regrets) and was oozing plenty of delicious cheese. This made me want to try their grilled cheese as well.... which will have to wait until next time. My vegetarian fiance had the Vegan 3.0 and that was absolutely delicious as well, and also a good sized sandwich. All in all we were both really impressed with the food and I will gladly come back next trip to try a few more dishes.2. Pastries. Olive has a large case of fresh baked pastries that we munched on while we waited. They were out of a few things that we wanted to try so it might be best to hit the pastry shelf right away if you intend to get one. We had an almond and a cheese croissant which were both delicious. A nice add-on to any breakfast or brunch.3. Wait. We managed to hit that magical hour between breakfast and lunch on a weekday, and still ended up waiting 25 minutes. It became overly packed after we had sat down and the lunch hour rolled in. I would try to go on an off hour unless you don't mind waiting a decent amount because by the time we left there was easily an hours worth of people, though I'm sure some were getting their orders to go.4. Veggie Friendly. There are a few vegetarian friendly items (usually I'd exclude grilled cheese because its just bread and cheese but damn did theirs look good). Always nice when the vegetarians at the table have more than 1 or 2 choices.5. Price. For what you get I actually think Olive is priced very solidly. $10 - $15 for a sandwich (keep in mind that's Canadian) but the portions are large enough that you'll probably end up taking half home. Throw on a pastry and that a solid breakfast and lunch. Works for me every time.I wish I was a bit closer to Olive & Gourmando, instead of an entire country away. Still it's nice to have a great place in your back pocket for when you head back to Montreal. I was impressed with this place and plan to head back whenever I'm in the neighborhood!Overall Grade: A

I was very excited to visit Olive & Gourmando after hearing so much about the place. However, my visit in May was a disappointment in more ways than one.I had the oeuf croquette which was a sad muddle of eggs, tomato, chickpeas, etc.- all I could really taste was the tomatoes. The bread that came with it was good; that's about all that's positive I can say of the meal (perhaps the fault lay in my ordering)What truly made it a terrible experience however, was the way the waitress (whose name I'll leave out) spoke to one of my friends. My friend mentioned how we couldn't enjoy our meals because of our seating arrangement- we didn't expect anything to change, just a statement of our lack of enjoyment after waiting for over an hour to sit. In response, the waitress literally snapped at my friend, creating a scene- the people at the nearby table looked up in surprise, and perhaps noting her behavior, she did not even return to our table with the check. Till now, I wonder if being four young women of color had anything to do with how we were treated, because I can't imagine her talking to someone older this way. We paid our bill in shock (I wish we hadn't in retrospect) and exited as soon as possible. When we later called the manager to express disappointment at the way we were treated, we were insulted and hung up on.This is a very popular restaurant and I'm sure the famous brioches are good enough to keep people coming. I'm sure most people who visit have no altercation and leave happy. BUT their response to our small problem was inexcusable. It was hands-down the worst service experience I've ever had in my life and I will never return, nor will recommend, this place to any acquaintance. If someone from the restaurant reads this, please be kind and respectful to all your customers in the future, and try not to take advantage of your popularity. Best.

Written up in the local press and for reason. We had an excellent brunch at this restaurant. We waited 30 minutes for a table, and used that time to plan the rest of our trip. The staff was attentive and the food was tasty. Plates we average sized and two are recommended for lunch. We ordered: Eggs with tomato sauce+++++A perfectly poached egg was situated in the middle of a clay bowl filled with rich tomato sauce and feta. The side of Portuguese break was dipped in olive oil.Yoghurt with granola+++++Way above average, the yoghurt cake placed on the right side of the bowl, that matched the fruit on the left. Granola was added tastefully on the top. The fruit was beyond you average mix, and included pomegranates, tangerines, and pineapple.Salad with chicken+++A mix of green lettuce and frisée mixed with toasted almost and a few slices of grilled chicken. The dressing was an olive oil base with apple cider vinegar and roasted garlic.Coffee+++Above averageGreen Tea++++Above average.

Last week, I was at the old port and decided to try this place out. We arrived around noon and it was packed, we went inside and put our names on the list, we waited about an hour before being seated, I was starving and the waiter wasn't coming by fast enough for me. After another 15 minute wait inside our waiter showed up and took our order. Thankfully our ordered arrived 10 minutes after, we started off with the soup of the day, which was a very luscious tomato soup with chunks of sweet potatoes, carrots, celery, wild rice and chick beans. It was one of the best soups I have ever had.I had ordered the Miami sandwich, which consisted of smoked beef brisket, grilled red onions, cilantro pesto mayo, havarti,  and a pineapple and jalapeño salsa on the side. Wow! What a great combination, the panini was pressed with grill marks on it, the cheese was oozing out. The pesto mayo just brought all the flavors together. We also had a fresh baked chocolate cookie with a blueberry tart. Very fresh, sweetness was just enough not overly sweet.Altogether, it was a great experience, the wait was certainly worth it.  Everything we tried was delicious from the drinks to the food and desserts. No wonder they have such high ratings.

My family and I didn't have a good experience there though. It was not only because the waiting time was long, the cafe was packed or the service was bad. I personally don't think that they serve good coffee and the bakery was way too sweet. The paninis were ok, but overall, it was not worth the time and money.

Worth the wait! Must visit breakfast place in Montreal! Amaaaaaazing food..excellent service and a great place to hang out. We had the tartine and the coquette. Both had very good flavor and tasted out of the world! They have a lot of options for vegetarians! Will definitely visit again ! P.S Try to reach early as they don't take reservations.

It's worth the wait.  There seemed to be a wait every time we passed by, and I know why.Just eat here.  The wait time was much less than we were told, and the service was prompt.  The sandwiches and pasties were awesome.  Nothing bad to say about here at all.  We wished we stopped by more often while we were in town, but we are glad we did finally try it out.

***EAT HERE*** O&G is the cutest place ever! Yes you will have to wait but get a coffee and an amazing cheese biscuit and wait! Its worth it. We arrived around 11 am on a Thursday and the line was out of the door. We grabbed a coffee and was blown away by their cheese biscuit. It was moist with a crunchy top and had a nice spice of heat to it. The spice was mellowed out by the creamy cheddar cheese and pillowy inside. NO BUTTER NEEDED!!! Its in there! We were sated by the window on bar stools which gave a great view of the passerbys. We ordered the CHA CHA CHIA bowl which has this fruity chia pudding topped with spiced bananas and coconut. It tasted like Autumn in a bowl with the beautiful nutmeg/cinnamon/cardamon spices. It was very filling. We also ordered the Poached egg on your face" Panini. OH MY LAWD!!! This panini is made up of the most amazing bread with spicy poached eggs and smokey, juicy speck! The herbs and raw milk cheese calms the palette after the spicy sriracha takes over your taste buds. The best panini I have ever eaten. The first bite of crunchy/spicey/smokey/ooey/gooey/ cheesy flavor bomb explosion will have you spoiled forever!!!!!!! They have a huge case of fresh pastries too. We had the Almond Croissant. SOOOOO flakey and almondy and buttery.. ALL OF THE WORDS WITH THE "Y's"!! The staff is over accommodating even though they are so busy and running around like crazy. They take the time to make you feel as if you are the only person in the restaurant. They have wine and beer and mimosas!! OH MY!!! I want to be there right now!! GO!!!
Found this place walking around Old Montreal. Great café with fantastic coffee and even better food. Definitely try the salty ricotta salad and the spicy panini.

Montreal's food scene is outstanding; Olive and Goirmando shines amongst the multitudes of the amazing avenues the city offers - this speaks volumes of how great this place is. We tried the following: -- Hot Panini: it was delicious, had all the right flavors, I would give it 4 stars. -- Soup of the day: The tomato soup served that day was with out a doubt the best tomato soup I have ever had. We were trying to figure out all of the ingredients that went in to making it, but fell short of a few not-so-obvious ones. Our server was so kind she wrote all the ingredients down on a list for us. I would give it a 6/5:yes it was that good.-- Tartine(Vegan): Not like I have had my fair share of Tartines, but I'm confident that this one would be extremely hard to beat. The medley of flavors blended so well together - certainly one of the most satiating meal I have ever had. 5 stars! -- Mocha: Epic. Ambience: It's a beautiful setting, the only thing I felt was tables could be a little far apart and they might want to keep a larger waiting area. But apart from that, not a thing I can complaint about. I highly recommend this place for brunch.

One of the best brunch spots I've been at. This place is known for their hot crispy sandwiches. Other items in the menu is just as good with amazing flavors. The bill was $110 without tax but covert that to USD it's about the same as NYC prices considering the amount of different dishes that we ordered.The vibe is good, the waitresses are nice and welcoming. The view is nice if your sitting at the window and occasionally horses walk by.

Came here last year on a friend's recommendation, and I knew that I had to come again this year on my Montreal vacation. Food was slightly less mind-blowing than I remembered (isn't it always?), but still amazing. I've tried the brioche (banana chocolate and just chocolate), almond croissant, elephant ear, Cuban sandwich, and latte and have loved them all.The space is super cute and always packed. Expect a wait at pretty much any time, especially during peak hours. One star off because service can be a bit slow - I waited almost half an hour for take out once - but it's worth it for the exceptional food. If the wait to dine in is too long, I'd still recommend getting a to go order and eating by the old port.

This is my favourite coffeeshop in old-port Montreal! If you look for a fresh and nice pastry to have it with your warm coffee also seating beside the window to have the view of old-port streets you should go there and give it a shot,you won't be regret! It's a lovely place!The environment is very inspiring,warm and friendly!
Came here for our last meal in Montreal.  Had a coffee, orange ricotta toast, and yogurt bowl.  The orange ricotta was SO good and will definitely be recreating that at home. Glad we stopped by.

Outstanding. I had high hopes that were exceeded. The food is fresh, a bit different and DELICIOUS.We had homemade granola, yogurt and dried and fresh fruit - yummy. But our ricotta dishes - we had both 'ricotta salty' and 'ricotta sweet' - were out of the world delicious. I will be craving these for a long time to come.This place gets busy and there is a wait - I think well worth it to experience O&G. Highly highly recommend!!

This restaurant is hands down the best place I've been to in Montreal. I had "this weeks salad" and it was not a disappointment. The salad was light, fresh and new. My husband and I also took a Chocolatine and Strawberry biscuit to go which I'm excited to try when we arrive at our new destination. I will be coming back here if we visit Montreal again.

Love this place. All the French pastries and baked goods are awesome. The location is ideal when sightseeing nearby or taking the metro. The Cuban sandwich is excellent, just have an open mind and don't expect it to be a classic version.
The most special thing about this place are the almond croissants and the chia pudding. It's also great for Instagram!

The Mr Miami sandwich was really really good! We ordered a Chai latte with soymilk instead of cow milk and they couldn't handle it. They were unable to simply prepare the tea and then mix it with soymilk before bringing it to the table. So they brought us a cup of soymilk, another empty cup and then the tea so we had to mix it ourselves.No matter what their excuse is, the mixing we had to do at our table totally could and should have been handled by their barista but they were unable to do it. Reminiscent of that Seinfeld story where Elaine wanted a big salad and the restaurant only served small salads... she asks for them to put 2 small salads in a big bowl and for some reason they were not able to compute such a request.

Come early if you don't want to wait too long! My friends and I arrived around 11:00 AM and had to wait a little while - seems to be always very busy, especially on weekends for brunch. This is a really cute place with lots of interesting pastries. We sat down for brunch and each ordered an entree. I had the chorizo egg dish - really really good, with the nice toasty bread. One of my friends ordered the Chia bowl, which came in a jar with lots of nuts and fruit. The coffee beverages are very good. This is a must visit for brunch in Montreal :)

Super yummy pastries and the sandwich we got, the Cuban, was good. Not the best I have had, but certainly enjoyable. We got the food to go because the wait was so long, which can out pretty quickly. Would l9ve to go back some time and eat in. It is definitely a popular place! The chocolate and almond croissants were amazing!
Hip. Lively and charming restaurant. Delicious cha cha chia bowl and almond croissant. Attentive and quick service.  A delight!

Oh MAN! Sandwich heaven is a thing and Olive & Gourmando has mastered the art. Came here on Sunday around 1pm to a decent crowd. The hostess said to expect around 20 minutes but it seemed all the existing party of 2's that were waiting before us disappeared so the actual time was much less. Any party more than 4 would take a lot longer I assume, as the place is very tiny. We were greeted right away and made sure to put in our 'appetizer' of a banana/chocolate pastry. We then ordered our dishes of the cubain sandwich & the Tartine. Pastry - honestly nothing out of this world, but it was very tasty. Especially as you get more into the insides of the pastry where you can discover all the ooey-gooey goodness. 4 stars. The Tartine - as I'm writing this a week later I'm in full depression mode. This thing was UNREAL. Check the photo below. Yes it's a bit pricey at $18 but they pile this thing up. There's no skimping. It was the most satisfying combination of sweet to salty to refreshing to filling. I'd recommend this over and over again. 1 million stars. The Cuban - came to us fresh out of the oven, had to take a bit to cool. So much meat & cheese with some awesome - but not overpowering - sauces. If you like classic Cubans, this will not disappoint. 5 stars. Service was quick, as they're trying to get customers in/out as quick as possible, which we preferred. Also perfect location smack dab in Old Montreal.

I was visiting Montreal with couple of my friends and we stopped here for a lunch. The wait was about 30 min on a weekday lunch (which is expected). The waitress was extremely friendly and explained the menu to us. Each of us tried different panini and shared. I must say that none of them disappointed. The sandwiches had a nice crunch and tasted delicious.I forgot the name of the one I got (it had the pickle mayo). But it was amazing! Would definitely recommend!
Ecellent Food, and service. Sandwich Pannini was grilled to perfection. Coffee and Baked Goods are awesome.
Nice place, good service. I love the croissant here! Visited here with my family. It was a small location, be there early to avoid long waiting

During that rainy day, we were strolling along the streets of Old Montreal.  It seemed like we were the only ones in the city as we were exploring the area.  Came across Olive & Gourmando, and it was packed with people!  Guess everyone was hanging out at this cozy little cafe.  Fortunately, we were able to grab two spots at one of their communal tables.Did not try any of their sandwiches.  We wanted to try their baked goods.  They looked so mouthwatering delicious in their display as we walked in.  Purchased 4 items.Brioche Choco Banana ($3.95)Almond Croissant ($3.75)Banana Nut Muffin ($3.75)Brownie ($3.75)Each item tasted quite good.  No, "Wow" factor with regards to the taste, though.  Would try some of their many other baked goods next time.Overall, Olive & Gourmando is a fine establishment.  Although it was a bit loud and crowded inside, I liked the ambiance.   Service and cleanliness was also fine as well.

We came in the morning @ 9am and had it wait 40mins. Pretty packed throughout but crowd starts thinning out around 10:30am. Nice and cozy, very hipster and modern feel. Quick paced, great for brunch and have baked goods to grab on the go.$16 - Tartine sandwich (Recommend). Bit on the messier end. Refreshing taste, a bit heavy.$17 - Coquette (Recommend). Probably their signature dish, also quite messy. Comes with garlic bread to spread the tomato paste and avacado on.$10 - Chia Bowl (Recommend). Cool experience, basically just a gains bowl in a giant maison jar. Very simple but the flavours work together very well.

One of my favorite in the city. The atmosphere is magical year around and the food is exquisite. I recommend you try their pastries and whatever soup of the day they have. Writing this review makes me want to go back right now (I guess I have my plan for the day).

This might be the best breakfast I've ever had. I mean, I'm typically a Bacon, Egg and Cheese kind of girl but this place defines breakfast in a new way.I came here two days in a row - the first to go because I poorly planned my trip and the second day, I made sure I was early.Nom, nom, nom.If you going to Montreal, this place is a must visit. If you don't make a stop, you better plan on going to Montreal again just to come eat here.

This brunch place is a must in Old Montreal! It's quite a popular place, so expect a wait that will surely be worth your while. We stopped by for brunch on a weekday morning and had a wait of about 20 minutes.This place is just charming. The weather was nice when we visited so the windows were open and we could look out into the street during our meal. There is also a wide selection of baked goods laid out that look delicious!
